review.reviewText: Dirty bathroom wall next to the toilet paper. Sheets had stains at the foot of the bed.

review.title: Quiet hotel away from the bustle
review.reviewText: Clean, nice, pet friendly hotel in Japantown. Small (30 spaces) parking garage available for extra $$. Staff was great - suggested restaurants, experiences, etc... They seemed to know some of the guests by name.

managementResponses.response: Thanks so much, Judy, and you have hit the nail on the head!  Designer NICOLEHOLLIS was inspired by the Japanese aesthetic of "wabi-sabi," which does incorporate clean and asymmetric looks.  I like how (in a subtle way) she incorporated a bit of the two neighborhoods where we are nestled (Japantown & Pacific Heights).  Hope to see you next time - Go, Giants ;)!

review.title: On the doorstep to Japantown
review.reviewText: Minimalist in styling but surprisingly comfortable. The staff are very helpful. They arranged our transportation to two venues.
review.positiveRemarks: Accessabilty to AT&T park, short cab ride. Wanted to try something a little different. It hit the mark.

review.title: Hotel that pays close attention to decor
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to public transport, but still located in a quieter part of San Fran in Japantown. My friends and I liked the actual room and facilities, but we experienced very loud neighbors that were probably drunk because their noise woke us up in the middle of the night. There was extremely loud yelling and banging of bodies or furniture. My friend called the front desk and complained. After the first call, the loud hotel guests still resumed, but after calling the front desk a second time, security seemed to mitigate the situation. Overall, besides these antics, we had a good stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff was pleasant and helpful, especially with parking info.
review.negativeRemarks: Response time to unruly guests.
review.locationRemarks: The location is right on the block of two bus lines and not too far from others. Since it's in Japantown, there's also great sushi options.

review.title: Good and Bad
review.reviewText:
First the good: The front desk was quite helpful. The room I stayed had a strong urine odor, but we went in it very much so I didn't complain. But the second night after moving my daughter into her university dorm, I wanted a nice rest. The room again had a strong odor and as I sit on the sheet, I started to develop a rash. I called down to the desk, he asked if this happened the night before, I told him the odor was there but not the rash. To their credit, they moved us to another room and it was fine. The next day, I notice a charger cable was missing. I think it may have been on the bed and the maid accidentally removed it with the sheets. It was never found.
The area around the hotel is quiet and full of restaurants. it's also convenient to go to USF.

The Bad: The room. It just felt uncomfortable. I also scrapped my leg against the bed frame several times as it protrudes and has a sharp corner. The smell of the first room I was in was not desirable. The 2nd room was much better. The hotel garage also gets filled up quickly on the weekend. There is a public garage fairly close.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms that felt cleaner would be nice.

managementResponses.response: Hi, Luis, and thanks so much for your review.  I am happy to see that the experience was wonderful overall.  Last year, we got a whole new upgrade boiler system so hot water should be able to flow like crazy, though perhaps there is an issue with the mixing valve in that particular room.  Please drop me a line if you have a moment and we'll get to the bottom of it, and also look into bed frame solutions.  Thanks!

review.title: Nice hotel in a quiet area
review.reviewText:
This was my first visit to SF and I really enjoyed the area the Kimpton is located in.  It is right by Japantown and Lower Pacific Heights.  There is plenty to see and different types of restaurants all in walking distance.  All the other main tourist areas are a short drive away.

I only had a couple complaints.  The beds, while very comfortable were a bit noisy, I think due to the base the mattresses were on.  Also, I was never able to have consistent water temps for the shower, I'm not sure if this is due to the age of the building or what.  

Those things aside, I would definitely stay here again.  The area is very quiet and relaxing.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, and three cheers for Demarco!  I have just shared this with him (and his manager ;)).

review.reviewText: I like the interior design of the hotel, it's very clean, comfortable, and Demenco (maybe misspelled) from the front desk are very friendly, thank you.

managementResponses.response: Nice!  Thanks, Marty!  I am glad you were as charmed by this neighborhood as I am.  It's great to be near some local things and not far from the touristy stuff while in a really friendly and relaxed area, free of crowds and conventioneers running around with their name tags and stress :)

review.title: Comfortable hotel in wonderful neighborhood
review.reviewText: Was worried this was too off the beaten path of the action...but found it to be a beautiful relaxing stay in a friendly neighborhood. This is how you enjoy the true flavor of the people of San Francisco not to mention one amazing home after another. Staff was very helpful in finding local restaurants and educating us on the best way to use public transportation (since we are from the suburbs of Cleveland, Ohio). Great stay !!
review.positiveRemarks: Streamlined, clean, and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Can' think of anything...if we needed anything they were happy to get it

managementResponses.response: Wow, you are some talented walkers!  We slackers who live in the city will often take taxi/Uber/Lyft/bus.  Let us know and we'd be happy to help you out with any of these if you want to save some calorie-burning next time :)

review.title: Nice hotel just outside of Japantown.
review.reviewText: Cool looking and comfortable hotel with a very friendly staff! The beds were comfortable and the room was good sized. The hotel is right at the corner of Japantown and the Fillmore district. Unfortunately, most of what we did as tourists was about a 2 mile walk away. Although I didn't mind, the walk was challenging for my 6 year old. However, the location probably helped with keeping the cost down. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay!

managementResponses.response: Thank you, VMH!  Hope to see you next time.

review.title: Very comfortable hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel has a Japanese flavor in its decor. The room was a good size and very comfortable. The location is perfect for Japantown (including cafes, restaurants and a supermarket-deli), close to Fillmore shopping precinct, and there is a bus stop just across the road to get to Union Square shopping and the BART.

managementResponses.response: Thanks so much, traveler.  This is the kind of thing the team really gets excited to read :)

review.reviewText: Well located, great staff, comfortable bed and enjoyed the happy hour.
review.positiveRemarks: Well located, great staff, comfortable bed and enjoyed the happy hour.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for your review, lizzie.  I better go have a look at the view from that room!

review.title: great hotel close in super area
review.reviewText: Had a lovely stay at the Kimpton Buchanan. We stayed in a room with two queen beds and there was loads of space. Good coffee machine and lovely toiletries. One of the best things is the hotel's happy hour. It's great for meeting the other guests. My only gripe was the view. We booked a city view (room412) and ended up looking at a supermarket roof. If you were really dexterous you could perhaps see a bit more, but certainly not what I thought I was paying for. Kimpton, this room does NOT have a city view! Otherwise great.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable clean beds, loads of room and happy hour.
review.negativeRemarks: Sort out which rooms can truly be said to have a view of the city!
review.locationRemarks: Loads to do nearby. Fillmore street is 10 minutes walk and has great bars restaurants and shops, albeit a little pricey.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, easy check in and enjoyed a glass of free wine from5-6
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and free wine

review.title: Nice Accommodations near Japantown
review.reviewText: It was what you expect from a hotel in the middle of the city. Lovely hotel however it was an extremely windy day and we could hear it all night. Also, the coffee maker didn't work.
review.positiveRemarks: What we loved about the hotel was the staff. when we told them that the coffee maker didn't work at check out, they offered coffee from the restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: Needs work on the weather stripping on the windows.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown and many bus line access

review.title: Clean and comfortable hotel next to Japantown
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! The staff was very friendly and check in was quick. The room was very clean and spacious. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in at a hotel, it was very soft. The hotel is directly across the street from Japantown, which was very convenient. Parking was kind of expensive (and extra $35), but in a city like San Francisco where parking is difficult to find and expensive I understand the rates.
Clean and acceptable.  Location is a bit out of the way for most activities.  I would not recommend eating at the hotel but social hour was nice---hard cider and saki mixed were nice new experience.
review.locationRemarks: The location is right across the street from Japantown.  A long but pleasant walk to community based shops and small sidewalk cafes.  Near Russian Hil

review.title: great location and wonderful staff
review.reviewText:
When we arrived there was fresh water and a staff eager to help us find our eay around
I could not figure out how to operate the shower so someone was up within five minutes.

We are back for three more nights

managementResponses.response: Thanks - and glad you got to explore the neighborhood on one of our PUBLIC bikes!

review.reviewText: Beautifully presented hotel in a great location. The staff are extremely accomodating and the free bike hire is also a bonus!

managementResponses.response: Hi, Anonymous, and thanks for staying with us!  We are working to add one more shelf in the bathroom to help folks lay out all their supplies.  The room size here is great, though, especially in the rooms with two queen beds.  I'd say our rooms average 50% more square footage than others in SF's downtown district.  I hope that you might consider giving us another shot to wow you further?  Thank you!

review.title: Nice hotel great location
review.reviewText: Staff were better that many hotels, room was quiet and clean, beds comfortable, in-hotel restaurant food was very good (decor mediocre). The rooms are small, with not extra much room, and not enough surface space in room or bathroom. We're stayed at the nearby Kabuki which has the same star rating, and it was definitely a cut above in terms of decor and space. Overall, I'd still recommend the KB as a very acceptable place to stay.

managementResponses.response: Thanks, Keeta!  Great to read you loved the stay and the team was so helpful to you.  We'll take a look at those two pointers as well!  Thanks.

review.title: Very nice stay
review.reviewText: I loved the stay the staff was very nice and attended to our needs. The only thing that I had problem with was parking need bigger parking area to accommodate all of your guess not leaving them to wait on parking space every time they leave. Another small pointer put chair on balcony

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the 5 stars and for saying that it was nice even to a picky person (like me :))

review.title: Cute boutique hotel
review.reviewText: The room was small but really nice and beautifully decorated.  The bathroom was huge!  Great bath products.  The desk staff could not have been nicer.  Wine tasting in the afternoon was a nice surprise.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything.  Just really nice, and I am picky.
review.locationRemarks: A close uber ride to Fisherman's Wharf, bridge, downtown

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Counterclockwse.  We will make sure that if you come back and see us again, we get you onto the 2nd floor or higher so that you're all set if you want to head to bed early!  I'm glad you'll be back in spite of the "learning opportunities" for us :).  Thanks!

review.title: Very nice staff, good location
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice, really liked the complimentary wine reception every night.  Our room was right down the hall from the in-hotel restaurant, so the noise was a bit annoying sometimes when we were in the room after dinner and until the restaurant closed (mainly during the weekend).  The location was great - we could walk 2 blocks over and be on Fillmore Street, which had lots of cute shops, restaurants, and a Walgreens.  Pretty close to everything else as well (we took short Uber rides to Golden Gate Park, Pier 39, Palace of Fine Arts, etc.).  Comfy but sort of noisy bed (the frame/support), and the top to the nightstand was wobbly.  There was a long hair stuck to the bathroom wall when we arrived though - weird.  Would stay again though!

managementResponses.response: Thanks, Janet, I am glad to hear we were the perfect spot for your business trip.  Isn't Japantown a hidden gem?

review.title: Very Nice Business Hotel in Convenient Location
review.reviewText: This was a much nicer hotel than the ones I normally stay at, but this is San Francisco and it's super convenient if you have business in Japantown, which I did.  The room had nice furnishings and the bed was comfortable and temperature controls were easy to operate and responsive.  They offered free wine in the early evening hours and there is a restaurant located on the corner of the hotel.  I did not look for nor find out if there were extra services available such as an exercise room or laundry services.  I needed to have my boarding pass printed out and the front desk gladly did that for me as well as arrange a shuttle ride back to the airport.  I loved all the Japanese restaurants and shops nearby in the Japan Center.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room, very friendly staff.

review.title: Hip in the Middle of San Fran!
review.reviewText: Great check-in protocols ~ warm and friendly and welcoming after a long commute. The extra help with transportation round the city was fantastic too. Reception area was fun and light and the staff was super helpful. They really cared about making sure we had everything we needed! The rooms were bright and hip modern.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy bedding! Super star staff members that are welcoming and friendly ~ they want to help you!
review.negativeRemarks: Not a thing! It was perfect!
review.locationRemarks: Everything is within 5 miles. Great food, ocean views, Golden Gate park, Fishermans Warf, Union Square... all super close. This was a great local!

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Anonymous.  Please let us know if there was anything we could do to earn some more stars -- and glad it seems you loved the location!

review.reviewText: area is comfortable . access to restaurants  etc are within walking distance . hotel is  not near noisey traffic
review.positiveRemarks: location

managementResponses.response: Hooray!  Thanks, Katie :).

review.title: Perfect hotel, clean and comfy.
review.reviewText: Will definitely stay here again. Staff were wonderful and polite. Rooms clean and tidy, such a shame we were only here for two nights. Will be back again.

managementResponses.response: Wonderful - thank you, Glen.  We'll make sure to share this with the team, too.  Hope the treatment was a big help!

review.title: SF for the day
review.reviewText: Just in town for treatment at CPMC, room was close, clean and staff couldn't have been nicer.

managementResponses.response: Wonderful - thank you, Cheryl!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Great and friendly staff had a wonderful experience!

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the five stars!  The neighborhood really does spoil us.  I'll share your nice comments about the team with them, too.  Appreciate you taking the time to give us 5 stars.

review.reviewText: It was a great family vacation and hope to come back to The Kimpton Buchanan once again in the future. Staff was really nice provided wine for a whole hour free on the house. Location was great walking distances to bars, restaurants, and markets.

review.title: Upgraded Hotel Tomo, better bathrooms, but...
review.reviewText:
We love this hotel (as we did Hotel Tomo) mostly for the location, a convenient bus-ride away from the Montgomery Bart station. The upgraded bathrooms are great: pretty, perfect lighting. The sheets are soft,
However, the main problem is the noise. We were far away from the ice-vending machine, but we could hear it in our room and it was unbearable. I felt as if sleeping in an airplane because of the vibrations from the machine. It looks like everything was updated but the ice-vending machines.
Another disappointment: I was woken up from a nap by barking dogs. I couldn't believe that they allow dogs, but unfortunately they do. They were two horrible yappers in the room right next to us. And the poor insulation allows for barks to resonate and prevent neighbors from resting.
review.positiveRemarks: Pretty upgrades especially in the bathrooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the ice-vending machines, don't allow dogs on the premises, install sound-proofing.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of Japantown, great restaurants all around, but still a pretty quiet and super safe neighborhood.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, Sue,
Since the team moved your room, I will hope to sort out which room number had all of these issues.  We will be on the look-out as I want to remedy the toilet paper holder and so on.  The hallways are looking much better with the redesign, and on the plus side, I see that you loved the location and the team was friendly and helpful.  So, on balance, I hope that we might get a second chance.  I appreciate your consideration!

review.title: Close to Fillmore Street
review.reviewText: Disappointed in "renovated" hotel.  Requested a king bed and was put in a room with 2 queens across from staff lounge/microwave.  They did move us.  Bolt on door did not work.  Asked to be fixed but was not.  No do not disturb sign that we noticed on other rooms.  Toilet paper holder placed too far behind toilet, hard to access.  Toilet "rocked" when sat upon, faucets were backwards, hot was cold, cold was hot.  Air conditioning unit kept resetting to 86 degrees.  No mini bar as advertised.  Hallway rugs were dirty the entire stay.  Not worth what we paid.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great restaurants/shops

managementResponses.response:
Thanks, Anonymous,
I'll have to tell the "great staff" that you enjoyeod their service!  The parking garage will have several more spots available in just a few weeks when we have all the carpet and things cleared out from our hallway renovation.  As you mention, the corridors needed a new look and I think you will like it.

review.title: Convenient location, great staff, needs updating
review.reviewText: Formerly the Tomo hotel (with Japanese anime theme), this is now more adult and more modern.  Still conveniently located in Japantown.  Staff helpful and friendly.  Hallways definitely need updating and dark.  Room itself was fine, but probably could also use updating.  Parking is a bit of a pain, since garage is small and always full, so you have to park in the Japan Center Garage a block away (though price is very reasonable for overnight).

managementResponses.response: Thanks, we are delighted it was a 5-star visit!

review.reviewText: the room is comfortable, and the location of the hotel is good.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the vote of confidence, David.  It is exciting to see the hallways starting to take shape, and that will definitely shift the whole vibe -- and the first impression especially.  The rooms were absolutely gutted for the remodel, leaving just the good "bones" of large room size, so once the hallways are more in keeping with the design, I think it will all present nicely.  We'll also have more parking available soon, though overflow is always available just a block away, and we can help with that!

review.title: Hotel in Transition
review.reviewText:
I'm not sure what's going on with this hotel's parent company, Kimpton, but this hotel, on a quiet street in Japantown (and a bit away from traditional tourist SF) seems like it was a budget hotel in an earlier incarnation. It's clear that Kimpton knows it needs improvement (there are signs all over saying "we know it doesn't look like a Kimpton, but here's our plan..."

So, there are not the amenities associate with other Kimptons and the hallways look, well, penitentiary-like. But, the bed was cozy and comfortable and the room was clean and it was a bargain at the price I paid. It's not ultra-luxurious (and has a parking shortage) but if the price is right, don't hesitate. It seems like it will only get better in time.
review.positiveRemarks: Price. Cozy room.
review.negativeRemarks: Furnishings, number of staff, decor.
review.locationRemarks: Central SF, so everything's accessible and speciality Japanese shops are a block away.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, ROP, and thank you for visiting us.  It's great to see the room was comfortable and the service really stood out.
The hallway improvements are indeed going to make a big difference to first impression, and they are wrapping up in February.  Then for in-room amenities, we have made sure to include Frette linen, Keurig coffee/tea, and of course the Kimpton wifi, yoga mat, umbrella, "Forgot It? We've Got It?" toiletries, upscale Atelier Bloem bath products, and so on.  We are also featuring shibori-print (kimono inspired) robes that are a fun sense of the neighborhood.  As we brainstorm, please feel free to let us know any other amenities you would like to see.  The parking cost is the best we can do, unfortunately, though sometimes parking packages are available through our website, and at least I can reassure you that the $35+tax puts us about $15 less per night than downtown.

review.title: Below Kimpton Standards
review.reviewText: This hotel falls far below the Kimpton standard of NY which is what motivated me to book. There were reviews referencing renovation...but I couldn't tell. The amenities were bare and the hallways were dismal. I booked a two queen balcony. I was so disappointed to discover the balcony was "faux". Don't expect any table or chairs to fit out there. You could open a sliding door however. There are signs through out saying the place will be updated but wait for it to happen. Kimpton value, standard and quality are lacking at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was comfortable. The staff friendly and knowledgeable.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall this hotel needs to MAJOR improvements in the hallways and the amenities of the rooms. Better furniture to create that boutique feeling.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown. Plenty of cuisine to explore. Relatively close to Union Square (about a 35 min walk/ten min drive). Hotel parking is expensive at $40/night

review.title: Nov 19-22, 2015 stay, 2 rooms, family trip
review.reviewText: We realize the hotel is under renovation....but the common area corridors on the floors were really a bummer.  Lobby was great.  Rooms were great.  Would come back if the corridors are completed.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Corridor finishes.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of walking/running/transit opportunities within easy access of the location.  Plenty of dining options within walking distance.

review.title: Perfect location . . .
review.reviewText:
Wonderful rooms ... Typical of Kimpton group.  Great experience overall!  Staff couldn't be nicer!  Wine served between 5 and 6  . . . excellent wines and very generous.  Quiet and great location out of downtown . . parking on the street no problem.  Very safe.
Thank you!!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything!
review.locationRemarks:
See above . . . 
Great shopping area . . . 2 blocks from Filmore street!

managementResponses.response: Thanks, Anonymous.  We like to think of ourselves as central and connected while just apart from the tourist mobs of Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf.  Between the various private and public transit services, you can go all over.  Though of course walking the three neighborhoods right here is pretty neat, too!

review.title: Nice location!
review.reviewText: Quite part of San Fran w/ lots of culture.  Easy access to everything.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks, Anonymous, and I'm glad you had a "great stay" overall.
I know just what you mean about the hallways.  That upgrade will be coming shortly, and in the meantime the rooms are all brand new, including those beds -- glad you had a great sleep!  As for the cigarette smoking neighbor, we have a zero tolerance for that in our non-smoking hotel, so, like you said, feel free to complain away if it every happens again and we will contact the naughty neighbor!    Thanks and take care.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is currently being renovated. Hallways are creepy in their current state. It was clean enough a little odd though. Bathroom door would not lock as it was a swinging door that would not even close properly. I like my privacy when going to the bathroom so I found this disturbing. The bed was very comfortable, I had a great sleep. I had requested non smoking area and I think a neighbor was smoking because I could smell cigarette smoke coming into my room. Luckily it was in the morning and we were getting ready to check out otherwise I would of complained. Otherwise we had a great stay.

review.title: Gave me the wrong room
review.reviewText: When I had gotten there they gave me the wrong room. And when they corrected their mistake they still gave me the wrong. overall a bad experience

managementResponses.response: Hello, Fidel.  I love to see that you enjoyed the location and the staff was so great and went the 'extra mile' for you.  We have recently completed window washing throughout the building and I can't wait till the new hallway look goes live.  We will also be spending some time repainting guestroom walls in December since the crisp white look of the rooms does leave little room for error!

review.title: Disapointing Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Far cry from the advertisement, ugly decor, dirty windows, poorly maintained rooms, courteous
staff, but other than that, not worth the money.
Would not recommend it to anybody.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was courteous, and willing to go the extra mile.
review.negativeRemarks:
Maintenance, up keep and decor through out the hotel and the rooms, the windows, hallways,
bedroom walls were dirty, not par with a Kimpton Hotel
review.locationRemarks: Location it's good, in Japan Town, relatively close to everything.

review.reviewText: The Kimpton Buchanan is clearly undergoing a transformation but even midway, I can see its potential. For now, you're facing a "murder-y" hallway, odd swinging bathroom doors that you can't lock, and (fairly) clean rooms but that is juxtaposed with a very friendly, accommodating staff, lovely lobby, wine happy hour and a great location walking distance of Fillmore St and located in the heart of Japantown. The walls were pretty thin and the lighting in the rooms wasn't great but honestly, compared to what you have to pay in Union Square for hotels, I still think this was a pretty good deal.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff who were patient with our requests for printing, ordering airport shuttles and asks for wine opener.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness, lighting and additional amenities in room.
review.locationRemarks: Fillmore St. and Japan Town shopping, great restaurants and music venues nearby, walk to Pacific Heights and Laurel Heights.

managementResponses.response: Thanks, Patrick, I am definitely hearing a lot of feedback about the hallways -- and though one doesn't spend much time in them, it is going to be such a better first impression and cohesive design when that awesome custom carpeting arrives and we can impart that boutique touch to be consistent with the lobby and guestrooms.  Meanwhile, I'm glad you already found the experience to be "nice and comfortable," and of course the neighborhood does give us a leg up, too ;).

review.title: Nice and comfortable, but not finished.
review.reviewText:
Hotel is currently in the middle of a transformation. While the lobby and rooms were comfortable and boutique, the hallways appeared unchanged from when the hotel was originally built - very boring, very drab, and a little run down. The Kimpton magic was lost as soon as you leave the elevator.

The location is great for those trying to get away from the Union Square area (less traffic and people, nice surrounding neighborhoods, and street parking is not unreasonable), and is centrally located for easy access to many areas of the city.  Also, it is surrounded by delicious Japanese food.

We were only at the hotel for one night of sleep, so we did not have a chance to check out the complimentary wine hour or try the restaurant, but the latter definitely looked very appealing.

review.title: Far from city center
review.reviewText: enjoy the stay most of the time...hot water was cut for almost the whole day..one chair disappeared even I ve do not disturb sign..TV channels were limited then most are gone.
review.positiveRemarks: Japanese town

review.title: Good location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is not new but it was newly renovated.  The area has great Japanese food and it's close enough to other neighborhoods. Our room was clean and spacious enough for 4 and the beds are big (queen instead double).  The free wine at 5pm was a welcome treat.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice rooms; courteous personnel
review.locationRemarks: It's in Japantown so lots of great Japanese food. Also, a nice restaurant for brunch is in the are - Sweet Maple. It's close to other neighborhoods.

managementResponses.response: Yay!  Thank you :).

review.reviewText: Everything was fabulous!! I was very impressed with all aspects of the hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the heads up, anonymous,
We will review your feedback with the team in our housekeeping meeting tomorrow.  Those little mistakes should not be happening.  Thank you!

review.title: Nice Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel, good location, comfortable and clean.  The renovation was nice, however there were small details in the hallways and rooms that felt like they kinda cut corners.  Not the level you would expect in a Kimpton hotel.  They were missing the attention to detail, but they were minor things- only 1 roll of TP in the bathroom, all the coffee in the room was only decaf, room service never showed up with extra TP when requested.  Overall it was a good stay, I'm just glad we had a coupon from expedia and didnt pay full price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room was spacious, comfortable, lobby was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: attention to detail.  Only 1 roll of TP in the bathroom, all the coffee in the room was only decaf, room service never showed up with extra TP.
review.locationRemarks: a few blocks away walking distance from Fillmore street with plenty of resturants and shops. Centrally located in the city, it was easy to Uber anywhe

review.title: Nice hotel, forgot the amenities.
review.reviewText: Went for Tomo got Buchanan. It was a much more a positive hotel experience than negative. It just does not seem to be together somehow. The room amenities were lacking, particularly the lack of coffee cups and glasses. We were given paper cups at the desk for coffee, had to take the wine glasses from the wine social in order to have any driniking accessories in the room. Staff told us we may be able to get coffee cups in the restaurant. That's true, but I should not have to go begging for a coffee cup at a Kimpton Hotel. Cordial staff, great location, comfortable bed and bedding, yes more positive than negative. But have expectations of a thoughtful guest experience.

review.title: Nice Hotel Under New Management
review.reviewText: It was Hotel Tomo when I made the reservation, but it had been changed to The Kimpton Bucannan under new management. The interior had been totally renovated and looks very modern in black and white, which I prefer compared to the previous Japanese animation theme.
review.positiveRemarks: Newly renovated interior and spacious and quiet room.
review.negativeRemarks: The only problem was that the hotel room did not have any booklet that explains about the hotel facility like all the other hotels usually do.
review.locationRemarks: Dining and shopping in Japan Town. Easy access to the bus line that goes to Sausalito.

review.reviewText: I stayed at the Kimpton for 4 nights with my two teenage boys. The recent upgrades are noticeable and well done. The lobby is eclectic and inviting and the rooms are quite comfy. If you are looking for a nice hotel at a reasonable price the Kimpton fits the bill. It is located across the street from Japantown and directly in the center of just about everything. We were able to navigate our way to all of the main tourist attractions with minimal difficulty. My only complaint would be the water temperature which was inconsistent at best. The real star of the Kimpton is the front desk staff. I interacted multiple times with several members of the team and all of them were helpful and extremely nice. We would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly front desk staff; location
review.negativeRemarks: Water temperature: went from scalding to freezing constantly
review.locationRemarks: Across the street from Japantown and about a 15-20 minute bus ride to all tourist spots

managementResponses.response:
Hello, Traveler,
I heard this once yesterday, and am thinking I need to get to the bottom of where / which website is listing parking as complimentary.  We certainly want to make sure that no booking site is misleading people!  On the plus side, I can reassure you that at $35+tax/overnight, our garage is currently about $15-20 less than rival hotels in Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.reviewText: Terribly expensive parking- it was supposed to be complimentary

managementResponses.response: Love it! Thanks for stumbling home to us ;).

review.title: Close to Japantown where I usually go out drinking
review.reviewText: It was a nice visit nice facility, like the furniture and the fact it was remodeled

managementResponses.response: Thank you! And please know that our parking cost is $10 below our neighbor and $15+ below other SF hotels -- sad but true -- so we are trying to give you the best deal we can. Others take their chances on intrepid street parking, though for my money, I recommend self-park garages like ours ;).

review.reviewText: Ok Good location clean room , small expensive parking. .............

managementResponses.response: Thank you, I love Japantown, too. I hope you got to try the authentic Shabu Shabu at Caf Mums!

review.title: good romm
review.reviewText: excellent room, good location, japan town is very fun

review.title: Construction
review.reviewText: Lobby and hallways were all a mess and there were drilling noises from remodeling project

managementResponses.response: Hi, and thanks for your patience while we were undergoing that heavy work at the entry area. It is quiet and smooth sailing now! The fitness center will be installed in July with brand new equipment, and even some outdoor access - stay tuned!

review.title: Going through remodel
review.reviewText: Hotel seems like a an older apartment or motel that's going through a remodel. It's in a good location and quiet but lobby is just a little space in the garage and  bathroom floors were dirty. Fixtures in room really stuck. Also fitness center is 8 blocks away. Staff were very nice though. Room itself was good size. It might be nice in a month but not recommended now.

managementResponses.response:
Hi, Toronto traveler,
I hope that you will come and give us another shot now that that construction issue is behind us. We love this neighborhood and hope to show you SF through locals' eyes: no postcard or t-shirt shops, just upscale shopping, dining, and easy public transit!
We also have some more Kimpton features in full swing now like a nightly lobby wine party -- to which we have of course added sake ;)

review.title: Not Yet a Kimpton Hotel - Under Construction
review.reviewText: It was a disappointing experience if you are expecting a Kimpton Hotel. The location was disappointing because there's not much to see or do in the area given the many exciting neighbourhoods in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very accommodating. The rooms were recently renovated.
review.negativeRemarks: Travelers should be warned in advance that the hotel is undergoing significant renovations. There's no lobby or restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: It is located in Japan Town which is a quiet neighbourhood with not much to do or see. The restaurants are good and it is a short bus ride to Union Sq

review.title: Nice hotel across Japantown with good bar/eateries
review.reviewText: Didn't know hotel was under renovation. Construction going on on the lobby and it wasn't pretty. They should have lowered their price more to compensate for the inconvenience. And I wasn't informed that the parking fee is almost $40/night when I could hardly find a parking space. Ended up being instructed to park at the disabled parking with a permit number given to me for display on the windshield. However, the room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. Staff too was very helpful and accommodating. Cafe Mums' downstairs served good breakfast and service was fast.

managementResponses.response: You are safe now! I'm sorry that end of May/beginning of June was a bit of a mess at the garage entry. That is behind us now -- and the lobby look is stunning. Please let me know how we can take good care of you on your next visit :).

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText: Make sure the construction is completed before you go.  The hotel smelled and was loud and dusty.

managementResponses.response: Hello, traveler. I know that the renovations in the lobby took a loud turn on May 18th and I am so glad that it was just one day of heavy work. The construction does still turn up a bit of dust here and there, but noise impacts are minimal and confined to the hours of 9am to 6pm. I am glad to see that you found the hotel so comfy and clean, and hopefully you'll be back to see us after our re-launch! We are looking forward to presenting ourselves as a neighborhood pied-a-terre, an alternative to the hustle bustle of downtown as you mention.

review.title: Be Nice when it's Finished
review.reviewText:
Am sure this is not a true reflection under 'normal' conditions but the hotel was undergoing considerable renovation work that I was not made aware of prior to booking
Other than being placed by the lifts (recommend avoiding) the room was clean & comfortable
Hotel in great spot situated in Japan Town with short walk to Van Ness Ave and main bus routes unless you're looking for more central bustle of Union Sq etc

managementResponses.response: Thanks, Northern CA! Cleanliness and the bed are so important, and what an advantage we have as new rooms continue to come online!

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: Just updated, very clean.  Feather coverlets and pillows.  I would recommend it
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, Kurig coffe maker, location.  Wine tasting in the afternoon
review.locationRemarks: Great thai restaurant next door.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for being our friend, John R! I am glad you enjoyed the un-wine-ding time and the salmon is my favorite, too! The bento box is an especially great deal at lunch time.

review.title: Appropriate name for Hotel Tomo
review.reviewText: Our room was very comfortable and clean.  Hotel staff was very friendly.  Tomo means friend or companion.  The wine tasting was very pleasant.  I do not drink and the waiter offered a glass of apple cider as well as bottled water.  We had dinner at Mums there at the hotel.  It was literally 30 steps from our room.  The salmon was delicious and staff most courteous.
review.positiveRemarks: Very pleasant and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints
review.locationRemarks: The Fillmore is only 4 short blocks away.  Nice neighborhood, no worries walking back to the hotel after the show

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Despite some construction debris, everything was functional.  Convenient parking, very busy restaurant on premises (which is good), and an unbeatable location right in Japantown make this a desirable spot.  Nice, clean, comfortable, large room.

review.title: Room
review.reviewText:
Around 9:30 p.m. our next door tenant pounded our door claiming he can hear us talking.. We were shocked and contacted front desk. We wanted to be re located but hotel staff claimed hotel was booked. Basically my son and I was whispering to each other and finally we went to bed at 10:25 p.m. somewhat scared of the guy next door.
We were paying considerable amount of money but the walls were NOT sound proof and  we were very miserable.. I traveled world wide never experienced such of issue.
I will re think before I use Expedia again.
Regards... Paul
review.positiveRemarks: Parking
review.negativeRemarks: walls are not sound proof .. you can hear a person at 40 dB
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: not impressive
review.reviewText: I will stay somewhere else next time. There are nicer places, I am sure.

review.title: Decent place for a great price
review.reviewText:
I was there more for business than pleasure - even though I stayed over on a Saturday night.

On entering the lobby, I was a little worried I'd made a mistake.  It was okay, but much smaller and a little more run down than on the pictures on their site (I am really picky).  I was very pleased with the rooms, however.  They were very clean and everything was in really good shape.  I got the place for a steal - so I was a little worried that I might have made a big mistake.  Not so!  I was able to check in via my phone and request a quiet room not overlooking rooftops.  They put me in a very quiet room that overlooked a courtyard.  I would stay there again next time I want to be in Japantown.  This place was proof that sometimes you get way more than you pay for!
review.positiveRemarks: The price and that it was very clean and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby needs some spiffing.  Nothing major, it just looks like things are getting a little worn.

review.title: Quick overnight stay with the kids
review.reviewText: Overall a good value. NIce location with easy parking relative to the rest of the city. Unique decor, pleasant staff, nice rooms. Be aware that the staff has no idea what the Expedia VIP+ program is and if the hotel is a participant in the program despite what it says on the Expedia website. So, don't base your decision on that factor. I was eventually told that we had been upgraded, but in reality there was no upgrade.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, price
review.negativeRemarks: Staff awareness of participating programs.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown and Fillmore street are very close. We were able to walk to Union Square in about 30 easy minutes

review.reviewText:
overnight stay after company xmas party, very nice room... altough I paid for king bed and we got a queen... we were so tired didn't have desire to complain with front desk... also paid extra $35 for parking, without notice, which was fine considering it was san francisco and late at night.
overall we did have a good experience and would come back.

managementResponses.response: Thanks, regular guest! We appreciate your loyalty and your review. I am glad that the hotel already feels renovated to you. We have indeed completed carpet shampoo throughout the facility and implemented yoga mats, umbrellas, and Kimpton's "Forgot It? We've Got It!" program plus free bike rentals and of course the evening wine party. The staff at the front desk might appear different as they recently worked out a schedule change, though I can assure you the team you've come to know is still here. Parking pricing did increase from $29+tax to $35+tax for each overnight, or about $10 more than the self-park garage. This has ensured the our garage here is less likely to fill up at the hotel, though! Hope to see you on your next visit to UC.

review.title: Hotel convenient to UCSF Mt Zion
review.reviewText: New ownership, switch from Joie de Vivre to Kimpton Hotel brought a few changes; new staff at reception and reservations so when I made reservations and arrived, I felt like I was in a strange hotel; 2) parking on premises went up from $19 to $45, although parking at Japan Center garage remains approx $20; staff is responsive, helpful; room appears to have been renovated but portable lamp switches did not work--required plugging or unplugging cord to/from wall socket;; toilet paper could be placed more conveniently.  Yes, I would return if discounted rate under $175 was available.

managementResponses.response:
Hi, traveler!
Thanks so much for coming to see us, and I'm glad you enjoyed the clean room and comfortable bed. I know that SF parking can be quite a pill to swallow, though the good news is that we have a $35 overnight price here compared to $50+tip at most hotels in the downtown Union Square area. I hope you'll come and see us again!

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of Japantown
review.reviewText: Nothing special but very nice and clean hotel. Pet friendly. Streets around could be a little bit noisy (especially in weekdays). Beds are nice and firm. One thing I didn't like - had to pay for hotel parking :( . In overall I had excellent stay.
review.positiveRemarks: web search

review.title: Great hotel in the center of the city
review.reviewText: This hotel turned out to be exactly what I was looking for. The decor was minimalist but colorful. The room was spotless and spacious. But the most impressive feature was the staff. They helped me with everything from early check in to change for the bus to restaurant suggestions and directions. I have already recommended the hotel to many people.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, quiet but an easy walk to many neighborhoods
review.locationRemarks: Walk to the restaurants and shops of Pacific Heights or Hayes Valley, or walk one block to catch the bus everywhere else!

review.title: 2 nights at the Hotel Tomo.
review.reviewText: The room was nice, but the design and atmosphere of the reception area seemed a little odd, compared to other Kimpton hotels.  Because it was raining, I chose to eat in the hotel restaurant with a friend, but it was extremely noisy.  The food was all right, but the atmosphere was a bit depressing.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was fine and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The reception area and the restaurant.  I think the restaurant needs to be redesigned to make it warmer and more inviting.
review.locationRemarks: I didn't have time to explore.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you, professional!
Charming location and local flare is what we're all about here. Fillmore/Pacific Heights and Japantown are just outside our door, so there is a lot to explore :).

review.title: Very comfortable bed and great shower
review.reviewText: We had a very positive experience. The hotel is in an offbeat location but charming.
review.positiveRemarks: very comfortable bed and great shower. Good breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: need more parking
review.locationRemarks: Japantown. a block from the movies and 3 blocks from Fillmore shopping

review.title: Great location and service
review.reviewText: I had a great time at this hotel. They have a wine hour which was a blast and the manager provided excellent service. Also, the restaurants across the street are really great and have high quality food.
review.positiveRemarks: I love the Kimpton experience you do feel like a special guest and the rooms are impeccable and comfortable
review.locationRemarks: You can go to union square and enjoy Japan Town.

review.reviewText: Clean, professional staff, good water pressure in the shower.  The only thing I didn't like as much was the restaurant - I felt like I was eating at a Denny's.

review.title: Enjoyed location in JapanTown, the food, the quiet
review.reviewText: We liked the closeness to the bus lines, downtown, the beach, the park.  The Tomo is small, quiet, pleasant staff, cleanness. We were there 10 days and it felt ilk,e home after a while. it isn't fancy, but that doesn't bother us
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was so friendly
review.negativeRemarks: The decor is kind of shocking, the murals are really different
review.locationRemarks: the bus lines, the restaurants, the movie theatre, the3 shopping on Fillmore,

review.reviewText: The location in J town is great. The traditional Japanese breakfast available at Mum, and the cute coffee counter at Benkyodo across the street, are two things I'd come back for!
review.positiveRemarks: Good soundtrack. The staff was very helpful and welcoming.
review.negativeRemarks: Can the balcony doors open?! New carpet. Get rid of the funky shower curtain in front of the closet.

review.title: Original decor, a class act
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because our family was going to Fleet Week in SF. The hotels we choose are usually boutique, cozy, with charm. I wanted to book a fun hotel that was more focussed on what my boys really love, gaming. This hotel was boutique, cozy, and brought a different charm to our usual choice. The way the anime was displayed, and the influence throughout the hotel was done very tastefully. Clean, very polite hotel staff with excellent meal/dinner suggestions. Dinner suggestions at other hotels (we've stayed), seem to be a reflection of whatever is the trendy tourist spot at the moment,  as opposed to where the staff truly likes to have a great meal themselves.   A wonderful stay.  We've already recommended this hotel to friends and family.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the rooms and decor. Great staff
review.negativeRemarks: The room smelled a little like dog, and our air conditioner was broken. We did get a fan for air.
review.locationRemarks: Breakfast at 'Sweet Maple', Ramen at 'Tanpopo', West Japan Center Mall for the best ice-cream at 'Chocolate Chair", liquid nitrogen made ice-cream.

review.title: Cute, funky Japantown hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel decor was fun and funky. Room was clean, comfortable and fairly spacious for a San Francisco hotel room. (I used to work for a SF hotel management company and know first hand how tiny rooms can be there.) Hotel provides forgotten items like deodorant, razors even a hair straightener (!) for no additional charge. Also provided a yoga mat on the room which was a nice perk for me. I thoroughly enjoyed the Keurig coffee maker each morning. The hotel is in a great location, two blocks from Fillmore, which offers lots of shopping and dining and drinking options.

Nice, clean, and a little different ! Loved the murals. Good night sleep with comfortable bed and quiet environment. Would stay there again for these reasons and the fact that it is close to shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Crappy hotel.
review.reviewText: Noise from the street, neighbors rooms, hallway.  Stinky Asian restaurant down the hall from my room.  No valet, but paid 20 bucks a day to self park.  Looks like ownership ran out of money when renovating this place.poorly operted hotel.

review.title: dope freshness
review.reviewText: comfortable and welcoming hotel, good location but still a quiet area of San Francisco, my only issue was that the toilet and shower were in one room and the sink was in another, not a huge inconvenience just thought it was a little odd, otherwise great hotel and would definitely stay again. $30 per night for parking seems to be the going rate across the city but I still felt this was a little extortionate.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable and welcoming, reasonable rates
review.negativeRemarks: better coffee in the rooms. cheaper parking rates
review.locationRemarks: good central location, 40 minute walk to most areas of the city, and plenty of bus routes go nearby

review.reviewText: rooms not clean mattresses not clean management unresponsive to concerns

review.title: Good location modern design.
review.reviewText: Loved the anime - nice to have parking at the hotel too
review.positiveRemarks: Fun graphics-nice interior design. Quiet at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Better shower heads
review.locationRemarks: Close to public transportation - walking distance to many parts of town.

review.title: Nice hotel in Japan town
review.reviewText: This is a quiet and clean hotel. Local cuisine with a Benihana close b. close to Muni line and taxi to Fisherman's Wharf about a $10 dollar cab ride. The hotel is centrally located for AT&T Park for Giants games, a short drive over the Bay bridge for A's Games. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The inhouse restaurant was very good as well. We will definately stay here again when we return.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything was great, staff very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is limited and a little expensive could be lowered if you are staying for more than a day or two.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Japantown and other things to do. Take the Muni or even a taxi is affordable

review.title: Convenient location for Japanese-ish food.
review.reviewText:
Easy to get to Japantown for Japanese-ish food  (not truly Japanese but so-so food by local people.  Much quieter than downtown San Francisco, and less homeless people around.  Good distance to Fillmore street for cafe and lunch or dinner.
Beware of limo guy always waiting in front of the hotels (Hotel Tomo, Kabuki Hotel and almost all hotels in town,  you'll see these limo drivers who would charge you very expensive price and they are 'connected' with hotel bellboy). They sometimes pretend that they are from Uber.
review.positiveRemarks: Not luxurious but simple, quieter than other downtown hotels and cheap
review.negativeRemarks: Need to stop having the hotel employee connected with limo drivers.  They are troublemakers for tourist!
review.locationRemarks: Go visit Japantown and Fillmore street cafe/restaurants

review.title: Close to Japan Town
review.reviewText: The hotel is reasonably priced for San Francisco.  It is quite a walking distance to Union Square but we like to walk so it didn't bother us.  If you like Asian food, some wonderful eateries where the locals hang out.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked how safe the neighborhood felt and how quiet the streets got after ten at night.
review.negativeRemarks: They could have been more generous in refreshing our towels on the second day.
review.locationRemarks: Great Korean and Japanese food.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: I would of have this hotel 5 stars but the beds were horrible.

review.title: Comfortable, quiet and convenient for Wharf area
review.reviewText: The hotel has limited parking which was a concern since we need to use one wheelchair however the staff was very accomodating and allowed us to park the car in the garage hours before our check in. The room was very comfortable, quiet an clean.  The restaurant had Japanese and U.S. fare and so accomodated both of us.  This hotel turned out to be an excellent choice for price, locale to where we wanted to visit as well as to get away from the crowds and noise at night.  The staff was excellent.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: About a 10 min. drive by taxi (we used Uber who came within 5 minutes) to "The Duck", wharf, Aquarium.

review.title: Very close to japantown
review.reviewText: Very expensive but close to japantown  and Fillmore.  Parking is costly and difficult if you drive a full size.  Hotel restaurant great for drinks and shabu but not American breakfast. Hotel staff nice and friendly.  Will stay by the beach next time.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, hip furnishings
review.negativeRemarks: Somewhat run down, parking
review.locationRemarks: Japantown, Geary and Fillmore all within walking distance. Close to california pacific if you are here for drs visit.

review.title: Decent Hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: We liked this hotel as it was in a quiet location and off the beaten track. There is a car free mall right across the street which we looked over from our room. We liked the close proximity to Fillmore St where there are many great cafes and restaurants. In particular we liked the Grove for breakfast, and Via Veneto for dinner. We found the staff to be very helpful in making suggestions, getting cabs for us, etc. etc. We were even able to change rooms quickly when we decided we wanted to switch to a King room from a Queen. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: quiet neighborhood, friendly staff, clean
review.locationRemarks: Near Fillmore Street; not far from Union Square

review.title: Really well located Good value
review.reviewText: For the money this hotel is hard to beat in the center of San Francisco. The location is excellent, especially for eating out. Frequent buses take you anywhere that is two far to walk. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. And the in room capsule coffee maker and well above average. Staff were great. we had no problems with hotel parking. We were very pleased with this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Room Comfort, location
review.negativeRemarks: Foyer is not very impressive. We had along wait for Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Local eateries of note. Sweet Maple for breakfast, Dosa, the Thai across the road from Mums and YakkiniQ for Korean BBQ

review.title: Good value for the price
review.reviewText: For a short stay would have no problem recommending Tomo. Nice area, friendly staff & worked well for a family stay. Good restaurants nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel, quiet area.
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel, beds good, located in Japantown, quiet location. Friendly staff, wifi was great, parking on site ( daily fee) .  Close to Fillmore Bakeshop, great bakery.  Centrally located for those who like to walk (25 min walk to Union Square), or are able to drive.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, friendly staff, quiet location.

review.title: Nice Hotel but very small dark rooms.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, rooms were nice but were very small.  The bathroom was very large and updated but lighting was very poor.  The hotel is conveniently located by the train line.  The breakfast menu was adequate but didn't really change.  The staff commented that pastries & coffee were available 24 hrs a day in the breakfast room but it turned out that pastries were only packaged cookies.  The breakfast area was very tiny and only accomodated a very few people at a time.  Booking in had its challenges but all worked out.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked it convenient location to the train line.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting in the bathrooms.

review.title: Not bad, good location, squeaky bed
review.reviewText:
It's a decent hotel.  A bit pricy but then you are in San Francisco.  Not bad but not great.  Room was a bit stuffy.  I did not think the decor was anything special though others on this site raved about it.  The attached restaurant was good though they wanted a $5 deposit when I asked if I could have a glass for the room (only plastic cups in the room).

One big negative for me, maybe not others.  I went with my wife and I would have to say that the beds there are not compatible with amorous activities.  VERY VERY noisy beds! VERY!  We were extremely self conscious.  I would not stay there again specifically because of the noisy beds.  That being said, we did not hear anyone squeaking that night.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, nice staff, relatively clean
review.negativeRemarks:
Non squeaky bed frames would be nice (mattress itself was comfortable and quiet)
Glasses in the room for water
review.locationRemarks: Smack in the middle of Japantown.  Lots of great food. Close to the Fillmore if you are going to a concert

review.reviewText: Great hotel and great room! Staff was very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the location. Park your car by the street and don't spend $ for the hotel parking at night!
review.positiveRemarks: Love love love it right by japantown!
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom needs to be updated.
review.locationRemarks: Right across from japan town. Not too far from walking to every places.

review.title: Gym and hidden parking fee
review.reviewText: The gym needs work. 30 for parking a day. Air conditioning in gym not working it takes a long time to cool in the room.

review.title: basic hotel
review.reviewText: Besides the small mural on one small wall, nothing else was special about the room. Bathroom was old. Not worth the expensive high rate I paid for. The only good thing was it was right by Japantown. Cute shops and restaurants nearby. Nothing fantastic to say about the hotel really. Basic. Will probably not stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: location

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay!  LOVED the Keurig in the room...   the furniture and room was clean and comfortable...  carpets needed shampooing.  Would definitely recommend!!!!

review.title: Very nice and comfortable. Clean and quiet.
review.reviewText: Has everything you need. Even an in hotel restaurant and bar.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: The lighting over the bathroom sink.
review.locationRemarks: It is in Japan town. Close to Fillmore St. shopping also.

review.title: Base for 6 nights in San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Good location, especially if you want to be in Japan Town
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel parking seemed expensive would be better if it were free or reduced for guests

review.title: Cool hotel but a bit far out
review.reviewText: Really liked the hotel. But it is a bit far away from downtown.

review.title: Great hotel close to everything in SF.
review.reviewText: We were on a girls trip celebrating my niece's college graduation.  Hotel is located only blocks from some of the best restaurants in the city.  Close to cable car stop and much more.

review.title: Very enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, with great food and shopping in close range. Very friendly and accommodating staff!

review.title: It's just ok but great neighbouhood
review.reviewText: Japan town is very cultural but it's some distance from the main parts of San Francisco. A cab ride does cost about 11-15 dollars to ferry terminal. Lovely neighbourhood and it feels safe.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: The walls are not very sound proof. You can heat exactly what's happening next door.

review.title: Funky hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in Japantown town so very easy to get food and good links for transportation. The decor inside is really funky and the room spacious and very comfortable. Will definitely stay there again! Mums restaurant downstairs for Shabu-Shabu dinner is recommended!
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious room

review.title: Very good hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: Overall very good. Really liked Japan Town and proximity to everything. Well placed for public transport. Staff were first rate and very helpful.

The walls were so thin that we could hear the people next door. Unfortunately for us they had a party from 2am to 6 am then it took them to 7am to get ready for bed!!!!!!! There was nothing that the front desk could. We asked to switch room but they said they were full and didn't have another one available.

review.title: Very accessible
review.reviewText:
In front of Japantown, several buses take you downtown and to other places easily.
Clean, with small refrigerator, and great service.
Will come back

review.title: Repainted old best western.
review.reviewText:
Safe and comfortable place to stay. Dated but they tried to update in Japanese animo style.
Our room especially the bathroom had black hair all over the floor. Enough to know a deep clean isn't done between guests...

review.title: Cool hotel, not for uptight travelers
review.reviewText:
The good:
Location was good
Room was large
service staff were friendly

The not so good:
Walls were thin and allowed alot of noise to go through. We didn't have noisy neighbors, but this could be an issue.

We found when we ate breakfast in the room, crumbs were not cleaned off of the table. This made us question the house cleaning.

Showers were not always warm.

review.title: Modern
review.reviewText:
The hotel Tomo was a discovery at first we were a bit disappointed because we thought it was nearer to union square, it's not really near waking distance wise... But the next day as we got use to the area we realized that the bus staton was just in front of the hotel,.. Still 12 stops from union square.
Other than the distance the hotel was super clean, modern, and it really has all then necessary needed.
It has a Japanese look wich was very cool ...

review.title: Nice hotel in japantown
review.reviewText: It was a decent stay. I would stay again. It is nothing over the top, but it is not a motel 6! Very comfortable bed, staff could work on some customer service appreciation and recognition, but nothing to bad.

review.title: A lovely place
review.reviewText:
Spent a few nights in Hotel Tomo on our honeymoon. Staff were lovely and upgraded us for free, as well as sending up wine and chocolates when they found out about our special occasion.

Our room had lovely character and all facilities worked well. Japan Town was something of an unknown to us before our trip but was delightful. There are also some nice bars a couple of blocks away. Decent public transport links nearby, too.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved that the lifts had pictures drawn by previous guests and that the rooms have nice murals in them. The in-hotel restaurant was good, too.
review.negativeRemarks: The place is a little dated, but (non-disruptive) work was being done to refresh it.

review.title: Terrible
review.reviewText: Rude obnoxious staff. Left me stranded without a room. Had to sleep in my car

review.title: Interesting and comfortable
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hotel Tomo while visiting San Francisco for Bay to Breakers (5/18/14). The hotel was 'full' but we rarely saw other guests. The hotel has a restaurant/bar that was very busy on Friday night but noise was not a problem in our room. Parking under the building was limited so we parked at Japan Center public parking about three blocks away.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very nice, with unique murals on two walls. The heating and air conditioning worked well. The staff was friendly and efficient.
review.locationRemarks: Japan Center has many restaurants, bars and shops. Grocery stores in Japan Center close somewhat early but Safeway is about six blocks away.

review.title: japantown!
review.reviewText: on the last leg of our holiday, we decided to stay in a different part of SF - after reading mostly positive reviews about hotel tomo we decided to stay here and we were not disappointed. on our first night, the air-conditioning was faulty and despite attempts by the staff to fix it, we were left to sleep with a fan on instead. ended up not being a huge deal as the nights were significantly cooler anyway. on the second day, the air-con was fixed and we even received a note and a little gift from the management - nice touch. it's really nice to see businesses show genuine care for their customers. overall a lovely stay and would definitely recommend to others!
review.positiveRemarks: japanese theme, close to nice japanese restaurants
review.locationRemarks: ramen!!

review.title: Wonderfully comfortable rooms, immaculately clean,
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel if you don't want a lounge or other facilities. The rooms are very spacious, great beds and bed linen, huge TV, iron, coffee machine big fridge and balcony.
Excellent position for resturants and cafs on Filmore and bus for Downtown stops just outside.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of the rooms and the location, also excellent wifi

review.title: Nice hotel, close to public transportation
review.reviewText: We stayed for 1 night at the Tomo Hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean. Bus stop is across the street, so there is easy access to go to the different areas of the city.

review.title: nice hotel right next to Japantown
review.reviewText: 30 minute walk to Union Square. Looks like under new management (Joy of Life) - still improving the lobby, but fine. Guessing they will institute wine in lobby like they do at Carlton. We had a room facing Sutter St so bit noisy in the morning, but actually quite quiet (guessing a room facing Buchanan st would be quieter.)

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Awesome I'll stay there again! Great location. It was great.

Quiet, comfortable, clean, and cheerful hotel in a great area. The eco-conciousness of the hotel advertised on the website is followed through. The only time it got loud was for a few minutes on Saturday night when people were leaving the restaurant downstairs. The staff was friendly, helpful, and professional.I wanted a little bit of Japan, and it was perfect. It was great to walk around Japan town and hear Japanese wafting around me. I had meetings at Fillmore and Bush everyday and felt comfortable and safe walking to and from the hotel.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel in the heart of Japantown
review.reviewText: Nice location right in the heart of Japantown with lots of Japanese boutique shops and restaurants around! Also only about one mile away from Union Square that I really enjoyed the walking. Room is clean and modern while the staff is friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Japanetown

review.title: Great Area, Clean Room, ok building
review.reviewText:
The location is great, close to Fillmore Ave. which is filled with boutiques and great restaurants, not to mention the epicenter of Japantown is right in front of the hotel, so lots of authentic Asian cuisine spots right there. Views are beautiful (i got a room on the 7th floor).
The room was great, it had brand new carpet, super clean, the mural i got had a "boogie monster" which gave me nightmares the first night, lol, but all good.
Staff was a mix of great and blah.
The downfall of the building is the restaurant on the first place. Breakfast was TERRIBLE, eggs tasted awful, and oatmeal was uneatable. The younger lady was a sweetheart, but the older guy was unpleasant. Good thing there are tons of breakfast places nearby.
Overall good value.

review.title: Very nice hotel in a very central location
review.reviewText: Stayed in hotel tomo with my wife and two little kids. The room was very clean. The hotel is centrally located for visiting most attractions in San Francisco. Gerardo at front desk was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: A gem of a hotel in Japantown.
review.reviewText: Conveniently located off of Buchannan and Sutter you are 5 minutes from Union Square by bus. Buy a Muni pass which includes cable cars and you are set. This hotel is a bit like taking a trip on the yellow submarine and surfacing in a Pokemon video. Enjoy!
review.positiveRemarks: The location is in a relatively crime free area of the city to access public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: They could reduce the price by 20 dollars a night.
review.locationRemarks: Well located on the edge of Japantown with convenient bus access and nearby Fillmore Street restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Comfortable hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: After we had checked in, the desk clerk offered to change our room to another which adjoined that of our last-minute traveling companion and her baby. It made the whole experience much more pleasant. The rooms and bathrooms were generously sized, clean and nicely decorated. The restaurant, Mum's, was cheerfully noisy, and provided good, but not brilliant, food. I would definitely go back.
review.positiveRemarks: Bright rooms, fun decor, comfy beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Our window seat was missing its backrest cushion.

review.title: Ooompa
review.reviewText: Hamburger salad is not served here but the mall across the street has delicous options

review.title: Comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our 3 night stay here. We found the hotel to be at the junction of the good and bad side of town so be a bit careful. Parking is limited but we managed to find a park every night to save ourselves the $29 parking fee. The beds are big and comfortable. Our room was pretty loud. Staff were friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds, free wifi, nice staff
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level, parking
review.locationRemarks: Close to fillmore st restaurants and golden gate bridge.

review.title: Fun area to stay in
review.reviewText:
We really enjoyed staying in Japantown. We got to try many good restaurants and cafs in that area, which offer all sorts of authentic Asian foods.
The hotel itself was different looking, and we liked the theme. However, don't expect anything overly luxurious. The room was clean, but pretty basic.

review.title: Cute decor, clean, friendly & professional staff
review.reviewText: Great stay. We arrived at 9am and super tired, and they let us check in very early which was really appreciated. Very professional, nice hotel staff. Cute decor of the hotel, very comfy beds, clean rooms.
Great location. Comfortable, relatively quiet, and helpful staff.

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Easy to UCSF (Parnassus); Very clean room, Convenient parking in attached garage; Inhouse excellent restaurant
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: Bed could be a little softer and the ice machine on the 3rd floor could make a little less noise

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Quite a good experience in this nice hotel, quiet and neat. Close to bus stops and easy tour to Union Square etc.

Hotel staffs are very friendly, told me lots about San Francisco even I arrived so late, around 11:30pm.

Nice chair and table for working
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, quiet and close to public transportation
review.negativeRemarks: Not really consider it is a 3-star hotel. To be frankly, it is better than most 4-star hotel in Las Vegas
review.locationRemarks: Japan town, easy ride on bus to Union Square etc

review.title: Wonderful hotel close to Mt. Zion Hospital
review.reviewText: Hotel room was clean and very comfortable. Very nice staff.

review.title: Quiet base to explore SF from.
review.reviewText:
Quiet and safe area of the city. Very close to Japan Centre with themed shops and restaurants. Buses stop next to the hotel for a frequent, quick, easy and cheap transit into the city centre. Minimal facilities in hotel communal area - no lounge. Hotel restaurant appeared popular in the evening. Breakfast here was cheap but of inferior quality than I expected.
Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Stay at the Tomo Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Tomo as we always do. We were going to Yoshi's the night of our stay and it is within walking distance. My wife thought the bed was outstanding, but we do like it relatively hard. The staff were pleasant and the room was clean--it does not have a lot of amenities but extremely pleasant place to stay and across the street from the center of Japantown--very convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and convenient
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Japantown and to the Fillmore district.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel Japantown.
review.reviewText: The staff at the front desk and cleaning crew were very friendly and helpful. There is a parking garage, it's small but they have one. Rooms are clean with big TV, small fridge, and Keurig single cup coffee brewer. Stayed one night. It was perfect.

review.title: Nice, clean and quiet!
review.reviewText: Once I got accustomed to the bizarre room dcor, I found the room very comfortable and quiet. Didn't try the breakfast but the hotel is five minutes from Filmore St which has some great places to eat. Really convenient for the bus into the City.

review.title: nice hotel close to good jazz clubs
review.reviewText: nice hotel, clean, staff was polite. i rated the staff ok only because they forgot to tell me that there is a button next to the entry light switch that needs to be turned on in order for your keurig machine and other electronic outlets on the dresser and desk to work. not a huge deal but i didn't get to make a coffee in the morning before leaving.
review.positiveRemarks: room was clean and nicely decorated
review.negativeRemarks: Bed although comfortable - was a little creaky. Headboard and Bed Base are wooden so our bed did make a lot of creaking noises with slight movement.
review.locationRemarks: it's nice and close to good jazz clubs and restaurants in Japantown

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText: A little noisy. I am not too picky and decided to take my chances after reading the reviews. I ended up in the loud room on a lower floor with the crying girls. I think it would have been a better experience if I was on a higher floor. The room was right over the parking garage entrance and they came and picked up the laundry right outside of my window at 6 am and it was very noisy as they chucked the laundry bags into the back of the truck. I would have been extremely irritated by that if I didn't have to get up anyway. On the other hand, it was clean and I did feel safe. The staff was helpful and parking wasn't an issue (a little pricey but easy to find a spot and easily accessible)

review.title: <3 of Japan Town
review.reviewText:
Hotel TOMO is very nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. My room was awesome with a decent view. The elevators had anime drawings posted on the wall, by people who have stayed there. The restaurant was nice with a good choice of American or traditional Japanese breakfast.
Only set back was low on hot water ( I like long hot showers ) and the first floor was getting repainted and wallpapered, so a bit of a mess. Otherwise I <3 TOMO

review.title: Our experience of Hotel Tomo
