review.reviewText: The room and hotel were disappointing. In particular the beds were not that comfortable and the rooms need a major cleaning and paint job. The staff were good and the breakfast was good in the restaurant but they are geared to Japanese customers and did not have anything other than green and what they called bread tea. They had no conventional tea and we had to go out for that..
review.positiveRemarks: The restaurant was ok.
review.negativeRemarks: major romm repianting cleaning is required. bathrooms are tored and need regrouting/refinsishing.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good and close to our friends' place.

review.title: No parking and the staff was rude.
review.reviewText: The employees were rude, the hallways are being remodeled and look like a psych ward with all the writing and scratches on the walls. And there is absolutely no parking. And heaven forbid you ask someone that works there a question because it's a huge deal apparently.

review.title: nice location
review.reviewText: OK for what it is. Could use some real renovations instead of cosmetic coats of paint.
review.positiveRemarks: nice quiet location
review.negativeRemarks: rooms were clean and adequate however they could use refreshing

review.title: Hotel near Fillmore District
review.reviewText: We were placed into a room where the bathroom was furnished for handicapped customer without giving us the choice; a fact that we did not appreciate.
review.positiveRemarks: just the location
review.locationRemarks: Fillmore district boutique shops and restaurants.

review.title: Been there done that.
review.reviewText:
All of the employees go out of there way to please you, and see that your needs are satisfied.

We could not use the safe in the room. The service person tried to fix the lock, but was not able to do. They immediately brought a new complete safe and installed it.

I wish they had more comfortable chairs to relax in. This is my biggest complaint.

I wish upon checking in that they would have told me to put my room key into the wall. This allows you to turn the electricity on in the room. It would be a smart move, to print that on the room key card.
review.positiveRemarks: See above
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: Convent to CPMC, Japan Town and the city as a whole.

review.title: Nice hotel in Japanese town
review.reviewText: Nice place, near great restaurants and easy to get to tourist areas...

review.title: Great locale
review.reviewText: Next to japan town, close to attractions and conveniant as well. Low price, a bargain in this city. Will be back often.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with a very convenient location. Muni bus right across the street....close to Fisherman's wharf and the Golden gate bridge. Made exploring the city and various attractions a breeze. The on site restaurant was good, pleasant staff. Definitely would recommend.

review.title: Very quiet and nice neigborhood
review.reviewText: I stayed this hotel for 7 nights for attending conferences in Moscone Center. It was very convenient to take Bus 2 or Bus 3 to the conference place from the hotel. And there was no homeless people round the hotel so it was very quiet at night. I will choose it next time.

review.title: Hotel in JapanTown
review.reviewText:
Visitig the city to look at some college. We took the bus into the city which was right across the street. Everything is fairly close----Chinatown, Union Square, and even taking the bart.
We were right across from the Japan Mall. Many options for restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Quite hotel. They have a restuarant on premise which we had dinner on night
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, I would stay here again.

review.title: Nice Stuff
review.reviewText: I like the hotel very much if the Heat could be better. Nice stuff, the grey hair lady changed the room for us since the first room at first floor is very cold and heat does not work. Technician came down first but could not fix it, and he offered us a small heat, we does not take it. A few minutes late, the lady came and asked if we could like to see another room on 6th floor which is not a king size bed room. We took a short look of that 2-full beds room, and checked the heat which is better, we moved to the 2nd room even I am so tired to re-pack, but it is a good service whatever. Convenient location, Bus#7 is just cross the street at the entrance of Japanese Town. The area is very quite and nice. However, I will say the carpet could be updated, but I like the Decoration of the room, simple, bright color. The round table and two chairs inside the room is a very good idea. We could have more space to put our stuff during the 3 days stay and eat light food inside the room, more functional than a sofa and tea table.

review.title: A little Japan.
review.reviewText: Nice art and very comfortable rooms. I had two rooms for my wife and me plus her parents. The only problem was parking

review.title: Cute Japantown hotel
review.reviewText: Cute, modern hotel in the heart of Japantown, easy stroll to sushi and shopping, our nontraditional family felt very comfortable there, easygoing, pleasant staff. Will likely return.

review.title: Very cute, convenient hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: Love the anime decor throughout the hotel. Overall very good quality for the price. Only criticism is limited hotel parking. There is parking in Japantown across the street about a block away that is actually cheaper though. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good business person's hotel. Small but ok room.
review.reviewText: Used the hotel for an overnight stay, and it was completely adequate. Comfortable bed and pillows. Parking expensive.

review.title: Great staff and location.
review.reviewText: Had a great stay at Hotel Tomo. All the staff members were helpful and friendly. Located in the heart of Japantown in a quiet and peaceful neighborhood. Access to MUNI and was able to get anywhere easily.
review.positiveRemarks: Its cute and reasonable rates.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown is a great area I recomend going to all the shops nearby and Japan Center. Fillmore is within walking distance.

review.title: Cute, convenient, reasonable
review.reviewText: Tomo is like a very nice motel but better looking. We found it pleasant and clean, great to be in Japan town and close to shops and restaurants on Fillmore. Best thing: a truly excellent shower!

review.title: Central Location!
review.reviewText: I stayed at Hotel Tomo for 2 days. There are lots of activities in the area although the metro system needs some work. The hotel was pretty clean. The carpet was a little run down but it didn't look too filthy. The bathroom was nice and clean. The walls are very thin and you can hear whatever your neighbors are doing...which is sometimes awkward. The only improvements would be cosmetic (paint and carpet).
review.negativeRemarks: Better thermostat control

review.reviewText: Perfect location and friendly front desk staffs. You can find a lot asian food around even late in night. Close to union square (bus stop nearby). Parking needs additional fee.
review.positiveRemarks: Interior design. Location.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning
review.locationRemarks: Asian market, shopping center, tons of Asian restaurant. One Japanese style shabu shabu all you can eat restaurant inside the hotel (24.99 per person)

review.title: Decent hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: We were pleased with the location. Easy to buses, and when we did walk a few blocks, it was a nice neighborhood. Very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is older, so if you are looking for a fancy five star experience, you will be disappointed, but our room was clean and comfy, and the kids enjoyed the colourful motif. Also pleasing was the presence of an ipod charger and easily accessible electrical outlets (even a usb!). The hotel restaurant was very good. Everything considered, it was a very good value for the money.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cost and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Freshen up the paint and decor.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of Japanese restaurants, and an easy bus ride to the main attractions in San Francisco.

review.title: great locale
review.reviewText: Easy walking to nightlife and east /west day attractions. Friendly atmosphere in a joining cafe.

review.title: Nice, easy going place. Good neighborhood.
review.reviewText: Nice folks, great neighborhood. Fillmore avenue is close by for interesting shops and eats. Excellent value!

review.title: You love udon? You'll love this hotel!
Good location
review.reviewText: I love the Japan Town and Pacific Heights area and that's why we chose to stay here. The hotel is okay, good for the price but nothing special, although the Japanese theme is fun. Our room was on the second floor right next to the restaurant, and smelled very strongly of food, but besides that was clean. Hotel parking is pricey, but we were able to find street parking nearby (not good for overnight, as its 2 hour from 8-6 and you have to get up early to move).
review.positiveRemarks: Location

review.title: Christmas visit
review.reviewText: We have stayed at Hotel Tomo! 5+ times. We always have a comfortable stay at an affordable price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, convenience of the Mum's restaurant downstairs for easy meals.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of, we will be back
review.locationRemarks: Japantown is very interesting for shopping. We love the Kabuki spa for massages. There are many fine Asian restaurants in walking distance.

review.title: Near great food joints I Japan town.
review.reviewText: Son, husband and I were looking for a hotel in a good location. Hotel tomo was conveniently located to many great restaurants. The room we stayed at was the executive room. It was big and with a balcony. Coffee was complimentary. My son loved the stay and so did we. We walked to the mall. Many shops nearby.
I love the overall cleanliness of the hotel. It's location is perfect for us to walk to stores and restaurants in the area (Japan Town is awesome!) and hop on a bus to downtown.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the 2 queen-sized beds, although they are a bit too soft for me, thus, a sore back the next morning.
review.negativeRemarks: The room is a bit stuffy so our throats get dry especially at night time. The towels are a bit rough; they need to use fabric softener if possible.

review.positiveRemarks: The best view of San Francisco skyline for the price.

review.title: Clean, comfortable lodging in Japantown, SF.
review.reviewText: This hotel is located very close to many good restaurants in Japantown and along the Fillmore corridor.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Nearby restaurants and shopping. About equidistant from convention center and the bayfront tourist areas.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a fan at all of Keurig coffee makers. The wall-sized mural was a bit weird.

review.title: Very good.
review.reviewText: Excellent. My final 7 days of a 5 week tour around the U.S were spent at this hotel. In many ways surpassing the 4* hotels I had stayed in. Direct access to the city centre and most of its attractions. (10-15 min. by bus) & located in a stylish area of San Francisco. My room had a fridge & balcony, the two things missing from my other hotels. The restaurant attached was extremely well priced as we're the hotel rates.

review.title: Amazing Stay
review.reviewText:
I stayed here for 10 nights with my girlfriend. The hotel is located in the very quiet Japantown area of the city. There are shops, restaurants and a Japanese mall located within a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. Bus routes can also be found within the same time to get you all around the city (downtown, bay area, zoo etc).

Hotel was amazing! Bed is amazingly comfy and room was clean and well decorated. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful (even wished me happy birthday on my arrival).

If i was visiting San Fran again i would definitely stay again. It provided a great base for seeing the city and checking out the culture if Japantown. Area is very safe

Think that's everything. BOOK IT!

review.title: Hotel Tomo San Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was in a quiet neighborhood, with available street parking and near many restaurants and shopping. Lots of city buses available nearby
review.locationRemarks: Japantown Shopping was interesting and plentiful. Near wonderful shops and restaurants in the Filmore shopping district too.

review.title: Easy stay
review.reviewText: We had a holiday party in the city so just needed a place close to downtown to stay for the night. Tomo is nice/convenient and there a lot of good restaurants and boutiques nearby on Fillmore.

review.title: great, wonderful location, clean,quiet.
review.reviewText: Perfect will be back.
review.positiveRemarks: everything
review.negativeRemarks: zero

review.title: Great location, beautiful views on upper floors
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 4 nights total and found it perfect for our needs (we're 30-something touring musicians). The garage couldn't accommodate our Sprinter van (10 foot clearance), but it was easy to find street parking and the meters are quite affordable from 9am-12pm. The in-house restaurant serves a nice breakfast, both American and Japanese style, and the front desk staff were always pleasant, quick and helpful with receiving packages, adding a room to the reservation, etc. Definitely would stay here again!
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to everything on Fillmore Street. Baker and Banker is also a few blocks awayhighly recommended for a special dinner!

review.positiveRemarks: I LOVE the art!
review.negativeRemarks: The beds and pillows are so hard! I really wish we could have had more comfortable bedding.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: My friend's friend referred this hotel to me, it's located in the japan town with multiple bus lines to almost everywhere you wanna go. The famous breakfast place sweet maples is only two blocks away. This hotel is so adorable with cartoon painted on the wall, staff were very helpful in terms of providing guidance and arranging pickup service to the airport. Lovely and affordable hotel. Thumb up!

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Japan town
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel, clean, and relatively affordable when you take into consideration San Francisco's sky high prices for everything. My only complain is that this hotel takes part in this charity organization, and they will slyly slip in a one dollar contribution without you knowing. I'm all for donating to good causes; I just didn't like not being informed.

review.title: Feeling Japanese.....
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the location and the hotel was unique and a great stay!
review.negativeRemarks: Fix water leak in ceiling above shower.
review.locationRemarks: Right in Japan town and great location to everything else.

review.title: Excellent SF Location, Vibrant but Quiet Hood
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of our experience, especially the location and the value proposition the Tomo offers. Just two blocks from Fillmore, where the restaurants, night spots and boutiques are charming and abundant. Sutter is not a major arterial, and with the staid Japantown mall across the street, it's very quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: The room size was good for SF, we had a lovely view to the west from Buena Vista to Presidio. For the money, this place is great.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a bit spartan and needs updating.
review.locationRemarks: The Fillmore District is fabulous. You can enjoy a nice walk in any direction. We liked walking west to the Marina District and Union Street.

review.title: Superb location at Japan Center
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel must have been recently renovated. Very clean, spacious room. Nice restaurant on main floor
review.locationRemarks: On Sutter Street, so on a major Metro bus line. Union Square only one and 1/4 miles away. Japan Center with all the restaurants across the street.

review.title: a nice hotel 20 minutes from safari land
review.reviewText:
hotel offers great location, with very nice rooms, and there is a heated pool and jacuzzi outside.

room are comfortable with modern design and comforts.

breakfast is an added benefit and no charge parking is also a plus compared to san diego hotels
review.positiveRemarks: nice modern hotel with comfort and at a great price
review.negativeRemarks: more seating in the lounge area
review.locationRemarks: lego land, safari land, old town san diego

review.reviewText: We've been here before and were happy to go back. It's always clean and the room itself has a very comfortable feel. It's right in the heart of Japantown, so you can't beat that! The front desk staff was nice. We didn't have need for anything special so we had very little interaction other than check-in and check-out. I had only one complaint: the bed. It really is very noisy when you move around, and the comfort was adequate. I admit, however, that we have a Sleep Number bed at home, so that makes just about any other bed less than comfortable. For a hotel bed, it actually wasn't bad (I've slept in much worse). I know some reviews sound awful, but all I can guess is that they had a rare bad experience or their expectations were way too high and then complained when they weren't shown a royal suite. I'm really picky about hotels--I won't stay at the same place twice if I found the accommodations to be sub-par in any way; and it's very difficult to earn a perfect rating from me, even if I really enjoyed the place. If you're just into the 4- or 5-star hotels because they have a national name, then you may not like Tomo. However, if you enjoy a cozy, clean room in a nice hotel with great character located in a fantastic neighborhood, you can't go wrong here.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Quieter beds!
review.locationRemarks: Japantown is fantastic! Also an easy Muni trip to Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel right next to Japan Town Shopping Cente
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel, stayed for 5th anniversary. Coloring was awesome and i enjoyed the traditional room setup.

review.title: Very nice hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: We stayed for five nights and liked it a lot. Pacific Heights is within walking distance. The rooms are comfortable. The staff very competent.

review.title: Great location, but worn hotel
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our stay but were a bit disappointed in how worn everything was in the hotel. The graphics were super cool, but the effect was more like an industrial building instead of a chic hotel. The sheets were very worn, the towels unraveling. The beds/futons were horrible. We sleep on a futon at home, but this was like sleeping on a concrete block.

We were with our 5 year old and found the neighborhood to be very interesting and easy to get around. Sweet Maple was our favorite breakfast place hands down.

We have stayed at other Joie de Vivre hotels and just never saw this level of wear on the hotel, so that's our main disappointment.

I gave the staff a lower score because they either completely ignored us or when we asked for help, they still didn't help. They seemed completely bored and uninterested in being there.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: new sheets, new futons, new blankets, remodel
review.locationRemarks: Sweet Maple for breakfast!

review.title: A complete, total, absolute ripoff
review.reviewText:
I chose this hotel because it was close to Yoshi's and was advertised as having a Japanese theme. The hotel is done in the cheapest decor I have ever seen - unfinished knotty pine, idiotic anime style graphics, an uncomfortable hard slat bed with only a mattress, no mattress. And - I'm not kidding - the table and two sitting chairs in the room were PLASTIC LAWN CHAIRS!! I couldn't believe it. They don't even provide water glasses, just paper cups for the coffee machine.

They have a 'SmartCard' energy system that didn't work, so I froze my tookus off all night.

The room had not been cleaned properly as well, with used toiletries left in the bathroom and a half cup of coffee on the table. And if you want ice, they don't have it on any of the floors. You have to go down to the lobby and have them get it for you. Very inconvenient.

If this was a youth hostel charging well under one hundred dollars, I would say it was just OK. At the prices they charge, I could have stayed at the Mark Hopkins or Continental. It is a ripoff, pure and simple.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing. Absolutely nothing.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Near Fillmore St. Shopping and Yoshi''s jazz club.

review.title: Unique and Wonderful experience
review.reviewText: Lovely theme, great location, very fun place. Gill at the front desk was particularly helpful and pleasant and she truly made a difference in my stay. Will be back.

review.title: OK Anime
review.reviewText:
just dark rooms with meat locker blue dim light in the shower room making it perfect for a Japanese ghost story...
Great restaurants close by though...popcorn ceilings...chipped paint on walls... Staff nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to good restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: atmosphere/cleanliness update.

review.title: Very handy for all our needs
review.reviewText: The staff and hotel were excellent. The only negative was MUMS restaurant was not top standard.

review.title: Great room great staff
review.reviewText: Great room great staff I would definitely stay there again
review.positiveRemarks: Nice size room clean quiet
review.locationRemarks: Grea t location near Fillmore District Pacific Heights and in the middle of Japantown

review.title: Nice location in little japan
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located in the heart of little Japan. There were all sorts of restaurants within less than a block from the hotel. The room was clean and cute. I felt like I was staying in a better version of a dorm room. I think every room has a theme to it. The walls were painted with what appeared to be comic theme background. I thought it was pretty cool. The bed was really comfortable and clean. I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean and conveniently located near restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: I felt parking was limited. More toiletries (shampoo, conditioners, larger towels).
review.locationRemarks: You'll find all kinds of sushi places within walking distance. Good place for a foodie : )

review.title: Fun and Convenient Place to Stay
review.reviewText: We chose Hotel Tomo rather at random on Expedia after reading a number of reviews, and ended up quite happy with our choice after spending five nights there. Because it is in Japantown, the immediate area is rather quiet at night, but that is what we wanted for sound sleeping. However, there are nice little restaurants and coffee shops/cafes within a couple of blocks distance. While we didn't rent a car and thus relied on public transportation/taxis the whole trip, the hotel ideally seems to be centrally located as our taxi rides for sightseeing, dinner and entertainment to the various areas of SF were always right about $9 - $12. Hotel Tomo was clean, rather quiet, and we found the staff pleasant, professional and happy to assist with our questions. The hotel's decor is fun (anime-themed) and the A/C and lights are connected to an energy-saving system that depends on your room key for control (not complicated to use at all). On the "small but important" side of things, the pillows were nicely firm, the way I like them, and not the usual flimsy wimpy hotel pillows at all. If you want to stay in the lap of luxury, then this isn't for you, but if you just want a clean, safe, quiet and nice conveniently located place to sleep at night while seeing San Fran, we can definitely recommend Hotel Tomo. I am told by local friends that most of the Joie de Vivre Hotels are like this--nice places to stay!
review.positiveRemarks: 1) Conveniently Located 2) Quiet, clean hotel 3) Pleasant helpful staff 4) Safe seeming neighborhood
review.negativeRemarks: While we didn't need to use it, the hotel parking rates (as most hotels are) seem high. We would have considered renting a car if more reasonable.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located for access to most areas of San Fran (average $10 taxi ride away) and plenty of shops, cafes and restaurants a short walk away.

review.title: Overnight in the City
review.reviewText:
Started a bit rough... i prepaid for two rooms (or so i thought) and was told by staff that they were completely booked and only had 1 room left. After some perseverance on my part, suddenly this was a mistake and two rooms were available?? only took 30 mins. We were checking in at 930pm and maybe this adds to some of the confusion... In any event, i had called the hotel earlier in the day to verify parking was available as I knew would be checking in later and was told there was plenty of on-site parking. but, when we arrived parking was not available.

when we go to the rooms, they were ok. the decorations were interesting -not over the top like i was expecting. the tv would not work, the climate control system didn't work either. there was a manual in the hotel binder in the room which i reviewed and then decided to open the window as there was something definitely wrong with the thermostat.

beyond these minor discomforts, the hotel seemed fine. staff was nice and would have rated them higher if not for the bumbling manager that struggled at our check in. the restaurant closed at 10 pm so i was not able to experience it. the location in relation to Japan town was good -right in the middle. i don't think i would recommend this hotel as it was nothing special. It wasn't bad... but wasn't all that great either.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Japan Town
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Staff was friendly. Only complaint was that parking was limited.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was within walking distance of many attractions. Lots of stores and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Visit Japan Town, go to restaurants take bus to downtown.

review.title: Stylish hotel in Japantown but a bit noisy
review.reviewText:
I stayed there for one night.
Initially I booked another Joie de Vivre hotel - Tomo, but somehow they messed my reservation and by the time I arrived to Tomo, they told me that they don't have room for me and offered room at Kabuki (which is about 3 blocks away from Tomo).

I'm not sure what kind of room did I get. It was on third floor in building 2.

Pros:
1. Big room
2. Huge bathroom with separated bathtub and shower
3. Nice interior in room and hotel itself
4. On-site restaurant offers breakfast buffet
5. Selection of snacks available for purchase in room

Cons:
1. A bit noise because of the street. It could be problem with my room only and personally I'm not used to noise, since haven't lived in a big city for last few years.
review.positiveRemarks: Interiors
review.negativeRemarks: Better windows to make it less noisy
review.locationRemarks: Close to Japantown

review.title: Go elsewhere for breakfast
review.reviewText: Fails on what is offered for breakfast. given the cost breakfast should be part of the price. What was on offer for breakfast was limited.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast

review.title: Cool location, cool room, very laid back
review.reviewText: This was the coolest hotel I stayed in while I was in San Francisco. Staff was friendly, but not phony. Slightly aloof, perfect place for writers like me. Or other artists looking for a quiet place to come home to after partying/ exploring the city. Good Japanese restaurant in hotel. Excellent lunch specials & bar. Very Quiet atmosphere. but Yuppies would be unhappy here. I felt creative energy flowing through this place. Looked like lots of families & kids in morning but college kids & groups of twenty something @ night.
review.positiveRemarks: Japanese Restaurant on 1st floor. Cool lobby, cool artwork throughout hotel. Cool people , surrounded by tons of shops. whole foods nearby. Near Polk.
review.negativeRemarks: The only complaint I have is the noise of machines at night. Not sure if our room was by broiler or elevator but was LOUD. Kept me up late
review.locationRemarks: Buddhist temple, tons of sushi sake Japanese markets, book shops gifts. in the middle of Japanese art scene, architecture, museums, close to Van Ness

review.title: Japantown visit
review.reviewText: My kids have only been to SF once before and this was our first time visiting Japantown. We enjoyed being so close to the Japantown shopping (especially the Japanese dollar store) and many restaurants. We tried Japanese noodles (udon, soba), floating boat sushi, and shabu shabu (Japanese fondue). We loved the strawberry mochi too under the Peace Pagoda. One night we also walked to the Sundance Kobuki to see a movie. We also enjoyed taking the bus, which is right near the hotel, to Union Square and Chinatown. Overall I felt safe in the neighborhood and the hotel felt comfortable and clean. We would definitely recommend the Hotel Tomo.

review.title: Strictly a budget play
review.reviewText:
We picked this hotel since the price was reasonable during a pricey time in SF. It was a decent place, and its not in the Tenderloin hood (avoid that). There is nothing wrong with Tomo, but you may find some things not quite how you'd like them.

Also, request a room NOT on the 1st floor. The smell of the restaurant can be a little off putting.
review.positiveRemarks: Price was good. Rooms are good size. Good neighborhood.
review.negativeRemarks: You have to plan in advance when you need a taxi. The beds very hard. The bathrooms are mediocre.
review.locationRemarks: Its 2 blocks to non-Japanese restaurants. I used a web delivery service for room service. Was there for work, so didn't seek out things to do.

review.title: Perfect choice for our trip.
review.reviewText: My daughter and I were very pleased with the hotel and the staff. Our room was very clean when we arrived and the staff kept it clean the entire stay. Everyone was very polite and accommodating. We ate breakfast from their restaurant every morning and have nothing but good things to say about the food and service. Very happy and will be returning in the future.
review.locationRemarks: The location is outstanding. We didn't even need a vehicle for the entire stay.

review.title: Great gem of a hotel
review.reviewText: I'm so glad I found Hotel Tomo. It's located in the heart of Japantown, which is a great location as it's footsteps away from authentic Japanese food. Not only does the hotel have a Japanese theme aesthetically, it has a Japanese level of service, which is always good! Japanese breakfast option as well, which is yummy. Most importantly, prices are reasonable (especially for San Francisco) and it's in a quiet neighbourhood just outside of town. Love it!
review.positiveRemarks: Japanese theme and breakfast!
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Japan town

review.title: Cute, clean, nice location
review.reviewText:
Hotel Tomo was a great choice for visiting friends in SF. The neighborhood is quiet and residential, there is a bus stop directly across the street, and within just a few blocks I found a great coffee shop/baker (Baker & Banker), a late night convenience store and a great brunch spot (Sweet Maple).

The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. I could occasionally hear my neighbors, but overall it was a great spot. I'd stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: rooms are clean, great neighborhood
review.negativeRemarks: soundproofing between rooms, especially those with a shared door. Better lighting in the bathroom.

review.title: Great hotel with easy access to anywhere
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. It was clean, the staff very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic with bus access to almost anywhere you want to go in San Francisco. It's also located 2 blocks from Fillmore street, which has tons and tons of shops, restaurants and things to see. I would definitely recommend staying at Hotel Tomo.

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText: Unhappy with my room. For the price I expect an air conditioner that works and to not be next to the restaurant. The showers were not warm in the mornings. The room was stuffy and didn't feel private. Felt like a motel with colourful Japanese stickers.
review.positiveRemarks: Parking price
review.negativeRemarks: Stuffy
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Tomo Hotel Review
review.reviewText: Close to Japantown. Restaurant was excellent. Room decour not great. Ice machines were broken. Parking was expensive. Service was marginal. Advertised discount for hospital stay but would not give it.
review.positiveRemarks: Location next to Japantown and close to Mt ZionHospital
review.negativeRemarks: Cost was too high for what you got, level of service. Was much better as a Best Western Hotel member.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of good food and shopping nearby.

review.title: Very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel in the style of Joie de Vivre. A great effort to replicate a Japanese style hotel, down to the incorrect grammar on the little sign about not smoking.
review.positiveRemarks: Bright colors and a sunny disposition.
review.negativeRemarks: My only negative comment is that it's really not BART accessible if you want public transportation, but there are several bus routes just outside if t

review.title: Worst of three Joie de Vivre hotels
review.reviewText:
Stayed at the Kabuki (favorite) and the Laurel Inn (fine).
Initial room spacious but screaming in baby next room; moved to a much smaller room (told it was same price). Missing lamp on one side of bed, no remote control, makeshift closet covered with what looked like a shower curtain, "plastic" table and 2 plastic chairs. Barely enough room to navigate between side of bed and chair. One side of bed had flashlight (non-working) in lieu of a lamp.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were gracious; breakfast good and reasonably priced
review.negativeRemarks: All of the above
review.locationRemarks: Sunday AM few choices for breakfast in immediate area. Within short drive to Presidio and restaurants.

review.title: Nice and clean
review.reviewText: Very nice and clean hotel, parking garage saves the hassle of looking for parking

review.title: Nice hotel for a lovely sojourn in the City.
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a quick stay in the City, close to Japantown and the wonderful jazz clubs around The Fillmore, Hotel Tomo is the place for you. Courteous staff, clean rooms, free wi fi, a unique ambience are hallmarks of the Hotel Tomo.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the unique ambience and proximity to the Fillmore. And, the staff was very courteous.
review.locationRemarks: We enjoyed the jazz clubs, shopping and variety of restaurants.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
My main reason for disappointment was the broken air conditioning! We arrived Saturday morning and were told they were working on it...still wasn't fixed when we left on Monday afternoon. They told us to leave our window open (3 inches was all it allowed). Yes it helped with the staleness of the room, tw temperature was constantly warm.
In my opinion, a weekend of broken air system is unacceptable!
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Very far from the sights of SF. We needed cabs to go everywhere in the city. Next time I will pay extra for a better location.

review.title: Great for groups traveling.
review.reviewText: The hotel was pleasing to the eye, spacious, and comfortable. The air conditioner did not work in both of the two rooms I reserved. The vending machines were sold out of water all weekend; however, the front desk provided us with complimentary bottled water. The restaurant in the hotel was wonderful, but almost impossible to be seated on a Friday or Saturday.
review.positiveRemarks: Cute murals and spacious rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning didn't work. Hotel parking not guaranteed and not free when in hotel garage.
review.locationRemarks: Japan town. Great restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Good and clean.
review.reviewText: The hotel in a quieter part of town. It was nice and clean and staff was friendly. The only negative part was that the fact that the guests were slamming doors. You should ask for a quite room, possibly corner room.. The hotel is located right next to Japan Town and it is a plus. I would consider staying in the hotel again.

review.title: Nice hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: Great location - close to a number of restaurants in Japantown. Excellent security in the underground parking garage.
review.positiveRemarks: Attached parking

review.title: My trip to San Fran
review.reviewText: This hotel was a life saver ! My friend reserved a room at another place, it was a dump & the guy at the front desk was rude. So i simply called Expedia & BAN! I got a nice room at Tomo for cheaper than the rundown. Really nice view & placement in town. Very clean! Nice artwork!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: The check in time can be earlier!
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants and bars

review.title: Nice hotel right across from Japantown.
review.reviewText:
I think I would have rated this hotel higher if I did not have a negative experience upon first entering the hotel. Arrived at the hotel and tried to check in (we had booked 2 rooms) in which the receptionist on duty was not very friendly (slightly on the curt side). Key cards were provided for both rooms, in which our party of 4 (2 couples) proceeded to our separate rooms. However, upon arrival at our rooms, our friend's key did not work at the room provided. Our friend asked us what room they were in and we all confirmed that we heard the receptionist say the same room number. They proceeded downstairs to get new key cards, thinking it just wasn't activated. My friend calmly informed of the receptionist of the situation and she responded very curtly and said "That's not the right room. You just heard me wrong." I don't think so, since all 4 of us heard the same number. Believe me when I say that is not how I wanted to start a vacation. My friend didn't say anything further and proceeded up to her room to get settled in. After that, we did not see that woman for the remainder of our stay there.

The other receptionists were very friendly and courteous. No further concerns regarding the staff.

Our room did have some questionable stains by the carpet area near the sink (blood, I think?). Room size was good. Flat screen HDtv in the room but there was no HD subscription so all of the channels were standard definition.
review.positiveRemarks: Parking available with a back-up lot in case it is full.
review.negativeRemarks: See above.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown is right across the street. Check hours of operation though - I believe stores started opening at 10:30-11am.

review.title: Great for a long weekend getaway
review.reviewText:
We went during the weekend of the cherry blossom festival and there was an outdoor market, music and food right across the street from the hotel.

The room was awesome but the only downside was that the second night, some neighbors were kind of noisy. No other noise issues though (and we were down the hall from Mum's, but they close the door in the hallway in the evenings).

There are lots of great little restaurants and shops in Japantown but you can also get around to the other neighborhoods as well. One day we walked to Hayes Valley then to the Mission District and back. Lots of walking but so many great places to grab a bite, coffee or a cocktail. We caught a bus a few blocks away that took us to the waterfront to walk around the wharf and Ghiradelli Square and one day I bussed out to the Golden Gate bridge.

I can't wait to go back!
review.locationRemarks: Great location and walkable - lots to look at!

review.title: Nice Stay in Japan Town
review.reviewText: Great location for anyone who wants to stay near Japan Town as well as being centrally located in San Francisco. Rooms were nice and mostly quiet. Was in walking distance of great places to eat from sushi to pasta. I'd recommend Hotel Tomo for families and students who can afford it.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice, quiet, unique cultural experience.
review.negativeRemarks: May not be ideal for business travelers.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located in SF next to Japan Town.

review.title: Modern and clean
review.reviewText: Nice large clean modern room at the last minute. Easy parking at the hotel but I used free overnight street parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Funky large modern clean room

review.title: cute Japantown hotel on a budget
review.reviewText: Cute little boutique hotel with excellent proximity to transit. We walked all over PacHeights and Japantown and found great resale shops, views, places to dine. The room was on the small side and the bathroom sink area teensy, but with two women we managed a good sharing routine. If one isn't the type to hang out in a fluffy robe and watch TV in your marble-appointed hotel room, this is the ticket for budget travellers. Great friendly desk staff too.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Very poor restaurant facility and breakfast was really poor. This badly affected my overall impression of the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Ok

review.title: A nice hotel in a quiet area
review.reviewText: Clean room with quirky Japanese-inspired decor, comfy bed, nice complimentary toiletries and that lifesaver for the business traveller, a decent coffee and tea machine. Good location, quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Japanese inspired decor, good quality coffee machine in the room, easy to connect to internet, both cabled and free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: Charge for printing and faxing documents feels petty. No room service available.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Japantown, two buses to Union Square run from the stop across the road so very convenient.

review.title: fun for a first visit
review.reviewText: love the look and feel of the place. a worthy novelty for a first stay. a bit pricey for just the added bonus of the novelty, so not certain if i'd stay there again unless i was bringing other people who i thought would enjoy the novelty or i simply had the cash to burn.
review.positiveRemarks: lobby, colors, off beat furnishings in room
review.negativeRemarks: was subtle enough design, i wish there were more extreme, equally priced options
review.locationRemarks: great location (in japan town); parking at hotel is too expensive, though

review.title: Good Hotel if your into Anime
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in San Francisco, we stayed local because of a concert at the Fillmore which is walking distance away. Everyone was nice and helpful, we had no issues at all.

review.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. Great location, good price. Kid friendly - grab bags for kids in lobby upon check in. $29 per day parking - fair for the area. Would stay again!

review.title: Clean, comfortable and fun.
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable and fun. We met the family for lunch at Mum's. Cooking their own food at the table was fun and kept everything lively. Picked Tomo because we had appointments at the VA the next day and wanted something easy to locate and close. If my husband became overly tired at lunch he could leave and rest in our room. As it was, lunch went fine and he and his sister had some quality time going over memories afterwards in a quiet setting. More seating than in a normal motel room setting.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, quiet and lots of restaurant choices. Enjoyed the shopping. First time I have ever taken the bar soap home as it was so fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't care for the dinner menu at Mum's. Wish they would put the parking cost on the website.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to locate and park.

review.title: Good deal for a business
review.reviewText: A clean and convenient hotel... I enjoyed. I can recommend this hotel to the persons I know.

review.title: Best place for ur money .
review.reviewText: The hotel is Sooo charming . I stayed there for a week and felt like home.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel in San Francisco, minimalist
review.reviewText: The hotel staff are always responsive, pleasant, and helpful. This is my first hotel choice when I need a place in SF, especially if I have any doctor appts at UCSF Medical Center, or if I need to use my car to drive around or to Berkeley. If I plan to use BART frequently, I find a hotel near Market St, like the Holiday Inn Express or the Hyatt (when they have a low rate available and I want to hang out at the Ferry Bldg.).
review.positiveRemarks: Relaxing, safe.
review.negativeRemarks: Far from any BART station.
review.locationRemarks: Safe, for women travelling alone.

review.title: Japantown hotel a good bet
review.reviewText: Hotel Tomo is a very comfortable hotel with unusual murals on one wall of each room. If you like Japanese food, this is the place for you, as it's located in Japantown, with several Japanese retaurants nearby. Mum's Cafe, the associated restaurant, even offers Japanese breakfasts. It's also convenient to downtown, a block away from a bus to Union Square; the bus from Union Square stops right in front of the hotel, and also goes out to Golden Gate Park. You don't need a car if you're staying here, and you can save yourself the $25 a day garage fee.

review.title: Great Place to Stay.
review.reviewText: I was extremely impressed with the hospitality of the front desk, the cleanliness of the room, the prime location of the hotel and more importantly connectivity to public transport, and my overall stay at the hotel. I would stay here again when I visit SF.

review.title: Fun, Colorful, Simple
review.reviewText:
The hotel is nice overall! It was a best western many years ago. It has been remodeled and themes Japanimation in a fun yet Ikea simple japanese kind of way. The rooms are clean, modern, but not upscale or fancy. Very casual, simple, and mostly tidy. The hallways and elevator seems sort of "cheaply" appointed, not in a "snobby comment" kind of way, just honestly like their contractor painted over best western colors and tried to freshen up a very old property. Carpets could use cleaning as well. They were stained quite a bit in the room.
Most of that is just commenting more than complaining. I really had no complaints at all. The staff was helpful and very friendly. The let us have our room early and were always courteous. The maid service was nice and through as well. As far as the part of town, its in Japantown. Not much to eat after 10PM unless you walk 10-15 minutes or take the bus elsewhere. the #2 and #3 bus run frequently right out front straight to downtown and areas near. We were going to a concert at the Civic Center and it was a 15 minute walk or 15 minute bus ride by the time it snakes around and get there. Either was it was convenient enough. The price was right and the hotel was a 3.5/5 in my opinion! :) Would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, Staff, Mattress, Balcony
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of food in room/hotel or nearby for late nights
review.locationRemarks: Heart of Japantown right on the bus line for the #2 and #3 bus. 15/20 min walk to civic center or food other than japanese obviously.

review.title: Perfectly clean hotel in a great quiet area.
review.reviewText:
Spent 10 days in SF at the Tomo. Great location, and nice hotel for the price - great room, very clean, and newly refurbished.

Only a small nit with the noise of the ice machine in the corridor at night, but it might just have been the jet lag keeping me awake.

review.title: Business and Family friendly.
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice. Minimal with nice touches of Japanese and Anime culture. Very unique decor. Overall the hotel is very clean and the staff does a good job making sure you have what you need in your room. Some little touches like TV guides not working on the TV, extension cords used in power outlets etc. bring the experience down a little.
review.positiveRemarks: Theme, Location, Size, Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Not very good power outlets and lack thereof. TV guide system not working.
review.locationRemarks: Located in Japantown and near many very good Japanese and Korean restaurants with plenty of unique shopping opportunities.

review.title: All round A+
review.reviewText: We were really pleased to have stayed here. The room and hotel was always clean, quiet and the staff very helpful. The location is fantastic if you plan to do lots of sightseeing in SF. Two buses run past the hotel and a late running bus is only two blocks away. Taking the bus, downtown is about 10 mins away. We also did a lot of walking as we were lucky with the weather. Two blocks away, Fillmore St offers lots of shopping and nice places to eat and drink. We're not fans of fast food and when downtown struggled to find good foodie places to go besides the ferry building. Close to the hotel solved this. As a base, getting to Alcatraz and Fishermans Wharf, SFMOMA, Golden Gate park with California Academy of Science and deYoung Museum, the ferry building... all were very easy to get to.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, modern, spacious and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Minor but small pillows!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent - always felt safe. Lots of options for public transport if walking is not suitable.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Good value hotel in a very quiet and easily accessible neighborhood.

review.title: Great hotel for a woman.
review.reviewText:
Very quiet.
The prople at the front desk are kind.

review.title: Nice hotel with excellent service
review.reviewText: I was personally impressed by the staffing at the counter. They welcomed we warmly and kindly introduced the nearby neighborhood (ATM, grocery store and so forth). They are also very accommodating!

review.title: Not up to expectations
review.reviewText:
Well,
We expected a little more based on the great reviews. The whole place feels like a reconditioned college dormitory. The animae theme is cool, but half baked. Don't spring for the balcony room, except to get a higher floor and if you are Elite Plus, you should tell them, since we are, they do honor Elite Plus, but failed to notice on our account.

Good Try, but the $70 extra for the Fairmont would have been worth it this time.
review.positiveRemarks: Japanese Theme, near Japantown
review.negativeRemarks: Disappointing appointments.
review.locationRemarks: Pretty great locale

review.title: Great hotel not far from city
review.reviewText: Nice and clean hotel with free wifi in a nice neighbourhood. Although the beds are hard overall the room is comfortable and not too far from union square
review.positiveRemarks: Free wifi and closed to japan town
review.locationRemarks: Nice location

review.title: Great stay in Japantown
review.reviewText:
I chose this hotel because I wanted to stay away from the touristy mess that is Fisherman's Wharf ($10 cab ride away, or you can take the bus direct to the wharf from the bus stop right across the street from Tomo), plus the hotel looked rather unique and got decent reviews. The hotel is very cool in the anime-themed aspect, especially the painted mural in the room!

The rooms were kept clean. Only a couple minor complaints i have about the room is that there was no bathroom fan (had a hard time believing a hotel bathroom wouldn't have a fan...) and the pillows were extremely uncomfortable.

Front desk was very pleasant and helpful. No complaints there. The night front deskmen was extremely helpful in taking care of a problem when we had some rude neighbors.

Overall a great hotel for the price!

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Really liked the hotel. Big room, very clean and comfortable.

review.title: Nice Beds and Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: The beds were very comfortable, and the room was exactly like what Expedia provided in the pictures. I loved the unusual Asian-inspired theme of the room, and it was bright and sunny. The location was a bit off the grid, but that's exactly what we were looking for. The front desk employees were very helpful and friendly. I didn't feel rushed. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: It is very nice hotel. Clean and comfortable. The location is very good. It is close to everywhere and the neighborhood, the Japan Town is quite and clean. I give 5 to everything about this hotel. I really enjoy my time there.
review.positiveRemarks: location and service
review.negativeRemarks: It seems that everything is ecellent.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Stayed for 4 nights. Really modern and comfortable. Different from typical hotel in a good unique way. Highly recommend. Super friendly staff to help navigate you.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: Pay parking
review.locationRemarks: Just outside Japan town. Cute

review.title: Will be back....
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Parking lot gets full at night, if you get back late you need to park at the Japan Center parking lot a couple blocks away. The have a mini-Keurig coffee maker in the room which was nice.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
The staff was wonderful, very friendly. Rooms are fresh and clean. Housekeeping does a good job, hard workers and very honest.

Hotel is in a great location. Can catch buses easily.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Front rooms get the food smell from cafe
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located for us.

review.title: Average hotel with slightly different decor.
review.reviewText: The hotel is basically a standard hotel that has been redecorated with an manga/anime style. There's nothing fundamentally different about this hotel compared to a Best Western or Super 8. But the location in Japantown is great, close to restaurants and shops. It's also close to the 38 bus line which takes you right into downtown/financial district.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot water in the shower was unreliable. Bed could be more comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Japantown.

review.title: Good for Short Stay
review.reviewText: Not enough lighting in the room and in the shower. There was some smell coming from the restaurant I suppose into the entrance of the shower, but it didnt affect the smell in the room. Very good location, comfy beds and facilities.

review.title: Totally adequate facility, nice staff, great locat
review.reviewText:
Loved the Japantown location, in the middle of the city near Fillmore restaurants and shops. Hotel felt a little more 'lived in' than the promotional materials showed and the physical plant was sketchy, Heater in our room didn't work and the hot water was out for a day.

But the staff was very nice and accommodating, I doubt the hot water was a one time occurrence. This was not a luxury experience, but entirely satisfactory, and the anime touches made for a unique memory.

Totally adequate facility, nice staff, great location. Recommended.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Across the street from Japantown and the Japan Center. Two blocks from Fillmore and restaurants of all variety.

review.title: Not a very comfy hotel
review.reviewText: Front desk staff were not very accomodating. There were some exceptions but ostly acted like they did not want to be bothered. The housekeeping staff were wonderful and kind. I hated that you had to keep your key in a slot to have electricty in your room because of this, I left my key several times in the slot when I would leave...thus locking me out. The lobby was disgraceful-nowhere comfy to sit but a giant, hard, strange "couch" and it was just very cold, not welcoming at all.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was right in the center of JapanTown

review.title: Maybe the best J-Town option.
review.reviewText: i thought that Hotel Tomo was a place of very positive energy. It was fun, well-kept, and the rooms were spacious and private. i would definitely stay here again, right across the street from J-Town!

review.title: good hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel in a good location. The bed and pillows were not very comfortable and the walls very thin.

review.title: Quiet Japantown
review.reviewText: We have a double queen queen room for 3ppl. Very comfortable and spacious. The free wifi is fantastic and stable. The beds are comfortable and the area is quiet and safe. Japantown is not too close to the downtown but only 1 bus trip (no. 2 or 3) gets you to the downtown in 15-20 mins. The rate is a bit pricey but its worth it if you want a quiet and safe place plus stable wifi in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wifi and quiet surrounding
review.negativeRemarks: Room rate a bit pricey
review.locationRemarks: Quiet and safe in Japantown. You will see the difference just a few blocks south of Fillmore streets. Good eatery on Fillmore street or in Japantown.

review.title: Value hotel w/ convenient public transportation.
review.reviewText: My only complaint was a very strong, almost suffocating, perfume in the room

review.title: Great Hotel, Great locations, Great experience
review.reviewText:
The staff made my stay nothing but enjoyable.

Event after an evening that ended with being mugged, I felt comfortable and safe.

review.title: Tomo!
review.reviewText: Hotel Tomo was a very nice place to stay. It was clean, and quiet. The neighborhood was nice and safe. The concierge desk was helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor was really cool and I had a nice view from my room.
review.negativeRemarks: The air conditioning in my room was faulty.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown is safe and quiet. If you love Japanese food then it's the perfect place to stay.

review.title: thumbs up!
review.reviewText:
Would stay again in a heartbeat! A great rate in a older, but well maintained hotel just a few short blocks from everywhere I needed to be in the city center. Super safe area, great staff and parking. (at a 25.00+tax rate per day city standard) Spent 3 days there and enjoyed the krieg in room coffee maker! Comfortable beds and large flat screens made for the days wind down awesome.
Thanks and see you soon San Francisco!

review.title: parking nightmare
review.reviewText: One thing that stands out the most is the parking. You have to pay 25 dollars night to park in the under ground garage, but they also rent the space to people around the area. So if you get back tot he hotel late you will not have a spot but you still have to pay the 25 dollars. Best case there would be spots open but you would have to double park walk into the front desk tell them you were staying at the hotel walk back to your vehicle and then park your car if by chance your car hasnt already been ticketed.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and the room location was next to the bar so all night long you would hear people yelling and the fire doors slaming right outside

review.title: Would definitely come back!
review.reviewText:
Great location. Great balcony on the top floor rooms.

Didn't try the restaurant - but enjoyed the abundance of options just 2 blocks away.

review.title: Great Hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: Hotel Tomo is a great, asian-themed hotel in SF's Japantown. It is really a nice area and the sushi in the plaza across the road is phenomenal!
review.positiveRemarks: The asian them and Location

review.title: overpriced high-end youth hostel
review.reviewText:
I have mixed feelings about my stay at hotel Tomo. Most of all, IMHO the rooms are totally overpriced and remind me of high-end youth hostels.

The good:
The staff was nice and helpful and the quality of service seemed out of place with the state of the hotel. The bathroom and bed sheets were clean. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood at about 5-10 minutes of the city center by tram/street car.

The bad:
The amenities at the hotel were generally "ok" but looked cheap and worn, especially the furniture which had chips and dents all over. The air vents connecting the rooms were very conducive to noise. The carpets were especially bad in the room we booked, with large stains pretty much everywhere. Breakfast at the conjoined restaurant Mum's was dreadful.
review.positiveRemarks: location, conciergerie
review.negativeRemarks: overpriced
review.locationRemarks: Japantown

review.title: Tomo Experience

The AC was not working properly, the faucet in the bathtub was not working properly, the top part fell when faucet was turn on. The staff were polite, helpful & quick to respond when called.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were nice & accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: AC not working; room was small.

review.title: Good location and CLEAN
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the staff very helpful. Our only complaint was that our room was right across from the very busy restaurant and next to the storage closet. However, we did not experience any problems with noise as anticipated. The insulation must be very good. The view from our window was just a center courtyard so not very glamorous but the room itself was comfortable and clean.

review.negativeRemarks: Parking was $25 per night PLUS parking tax of $3 pet night. Parking tax was a surprise.

review.title: Clean hotel in Japantown

Staff was very nice and approachable. The beds weren't the most comfortable but they were ok. Quiet neighborhood in japantown. Many sushi restaurants facing the hotel. It was easy to get around by public transportation as well. I would stay again.

review.title: good value for money.
review.reviewText: To be honest, despite the negative reviews on YELP etc, I found this hotel to be good value for money and in a part of town that made it very easy to find food (especially for Asian travellers). Access to Sutter/Fillmore makes it easy for cafes and breakfasts (a slightly pricey but very good cafe for breakfast down the road was Sweet Maple) so feeding yourself is convenient. Japan town is also quiet and if you get a high floor room (6-8th floor) you get a pretty nice view of San Francisco.

review.title: Would come back except for the parking

PROS:
- Friendly staff

CONS:
- Not enough parking in the garage for all the guests (had to park on the street, and because I would come back to the hotel rather late, I ended up having to park pretty far away, and as a single female having to walk to the hotel late at night, I didn't like that too much)

review.title: ok hotel
review.reviewText: it was an OK little hotel. it was not anything fancy. the price was a bit expensive for the quality. it is very convenient if you are looking to shop and stay around the japan town area. it's only a block away and there are plenty of restaurants there. the basement parking was kinda bad. it is first come first serve even though they do charge like 25 dollars a night. i do not recommend you park in their parking lot unless you have a small compact car because it is pretty tight in there. the hotel may be going for a "anime" theme appeal but there's not really any anime going on in the hotel, besides just having 3 tv's playing anime in the lobby. the restaurant inside the hotel is ok. breakfast is a mix of american and japanese food. lunch and dinner seems more interesting with hot pots, although i did not get a chance to dine there for lunch and dinner. i recommend trying the thai restaurant across the street. the food is pretty good. and ask for a higher floor room because the first floor is a bit noisy from the traffic outside. the rooms are simple rooms and a simple bathroom. nothing fancy. i dont mind staying here again if i plan to go to japan town but i would shop around for other hotel deals.

My only complaint is the lack of microwave, but with a cafe in the hotel and food only a block away, it was no real issue. review.title: will not be staying here again
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Tomo for 5 nights. We were there for vacation, and have stayed at several hotels around town. The room was pretty dirty, hair everywhere, it looked like it had not been cleaned at all except for a change of sheets and new toiletries. The key to my room did not work half the time, so I had to go down stairs to have it reset several times. The staff seemed borderline annoyed by this. The general state of the hotel is poor. It smells like the restaurant that is on the second floor. The elevator was broken while we were there.

review.title: HOME AWAY FROM HOME.....
review.reviewText: Definitely a home away from home experience. Plenty of space for a group of four in a room of 2 queen beds. The window view to Japan town with the seating made the room open and spacious. Modern decors and the color schemes were appealing. The quick response for room service was very convenient. Only concern was the parking fee for $23 a day. Although, if you're lucky.. street parking is available after 6p til 9a. Overall... this hotel will definitely be a repeat especially having a child during the stay. THUMBS UP!

review.title: A Very Nice Stay in SF's Japantown
review.reviewText:
Hotels in downtown San Francisco aren't cheap, but Tomo is definitely a bargain. Nice property, cute decor, friendly staff. Room service was very friendly and courteous, as well as the front desk. My only complaint about the property is that our room had no accessible electrical outlets. Zero. Nada. This explains why some of the furniture in the room was moved at odd angles away from the walls - so that the hidden electrical outlets behind the desk and nightstand could be found. There was a very nice and spacious computer desk, for example - but NO electrical outlets to use!! We had to pull the desk out further so that we could reach around to plug in our laptops. Same for charging the phone on the nightstand. This is a very easy issue to resolve - they need to install mounted power strips for easy access. This is obvious, but but I guess that doesn't keep people from ignoring it. At any rate - bring a power strip.

More about the area: Japantown is a surprisingly nice and quiet area to stay, with an authentic Japanese urban feel. Unlike Chinatown, Japantown is an actual established Japanese community in the Pacific Heights area of the city. Lots of Japanese-Americans live in and work in this area - but there seemed to be very little tourist traffic overall. No crowds whatsoever... just a lot of "local" Japanese - it was a great place to start and end the day during our visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, clean & comfortable stay in a great part of town.
review.negativeRemarks: Nowhere to plug in your gadgets!!
review.locationRemarks: Japantown is a great place to start and end the day.. quiet, peaceful and an authentic Japanese-American community.

review.title: Excellent value for location. Comfortable/Clean.
review.reviewText: Great value and location. Very clean and comfortable. We stayed on the 1st floor rm 126, facing the street (Sutter St.). A couple of times in the morning, the garbage truck or street cleaning vehicles would wake us early. The breakfast in the restaurant was very basic but good. Overall, a pleasant experience and we would definitely stay again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Street Noise. Outside Parking difficult to find (But they have underground available)
review.locationRemarks: Very central. Excellent location.

review.title: Just right.
review.reviewText: Although we did not spend much time in the room, it was comfortable. We appreciated that it had free internet and had a refrigerator. The staff was courteous.

review.title: Very noisy and uncomfortable!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in need of major renovation. Even though it has been redone with anime style decor, you can tell that it has the bathroom of a cheap motel. The carpet and shower curtain had spots/stains. There was either blood or makeup on the hair dryer. While showering, the water temperature kept fluctuating. The air conditioning did not work. The room was too warm for my liking, so I turned the thermostat down, but all night warm air was blowing out (I see now that other people had the same problem with the AC). The walls and floors/ceilings are paper thin. I was startled awake several times by some very loud banging sounds (occurring even around 2 AM). In the morning, children were running around playing in the hallway and jiggling our door handle. Needless to say, for a light sleeper like me, I did not get a good night's sleep. Parking is easy since there's a small parking garage underneath the hotel and overflow parking at the Japan Center garage across the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Wi-Fi, in-room safe, convenient location
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level, broken AC
review.locationRemarks: Great location near music venues, eateries, and Japantown

review.title: Lovely stay at the Hotel Tomo!
review.reviewText: We were in town for a conference nearby and found our room and stay to be everything that we needed. The room was clean, bright, comfortable and the price was right. We will definitely stay at the Tomo again. Loved the pop art and the general feel. The only thing I would complain about would be the noise bleeding into our room from the hallway. Though it wasn't too much of a problem after midnight as it seemed as though all the guests on our floor were tucked away in their rooms. Anything that we needed, the staff attended to in a quick and friendly manner. We would love to stay here again. And next time we will probably plan on taking advantage of the free parking available to guests! This hotel was recommended to me by a friend and I would definitely pass it along and recommend it to other friends.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were extremely comfortable! Great location and price. Very clean and a comfortable. Staff was friendly and very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Hallway noise leaking into the room. Needs more light in the shower and toilet room.

review.title: Great hotel!

review.title: Cute Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was as cute as the pictures, though there were no bean bags in the rooms.

review.title: Price brought us here...and it was great find!
review.reviewText:
The Japan Town location is very nice. This is not a busy tourist area but does have lots of interesting little shops and local eateries within a few block radius. The staff were very freindly and very helpful. Best of all the place was very clean and fresh. The beds are very comfy we all agreed. Rooms include a Keurig coffee maker and a small fridge and a nice big tv and an ipod dock type clock radio. Very nice. The extra blanket was a nice down comforter.
Even though we were on the second floor there was not a lot of noise. None of us had any trouble sleeping. There were some noisy guests for a little bit about 10:00pm but someone must have complained because it didn't last long.
The decor here is very unique, and frankly not to my taste, but one can always enjoy something different; especially when all other needs are covered so well. We would absolutley stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean. Keurig coffee. Down type blankets. Soft beds. Spacious rooms. Cute window seats.
review.negativeRemarks: Not crazy about the carpet. How's that for a gripe?
review.locationRemarks: Not too many tourists. Lots of local shops and eateries withing a couple blocks.

review.title: Hotel Tomo is the best!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. It is very conveniently located near Japan Town. You can get anywhere in the city by Taxi for around $10 or less. The bed and bedding was very comfortable. The staff is great. They are very friendly and always ready to help. The co-located restaurant-Mum's is really good. They have a great breakfast.

review.title: almost nothing worked,BAD CONDTION
review.reviewText: BEFORE I STAYED AT THIS HOTEL I RED OTHER REVIEWS FROM LAST YEAR. MOST OF WHAT WAS SAID THE IS TRUE. THERE WAS A HOLD PLACED ON MY CREDIT CARD FOR 50$ WITH OUT MY PERMISSION OR KNOWLEDGE.THE ROOM WAS PAID IN FULL PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL. I WAS TOLD ABOUT THE ROOM KEY CARD IN EACH ROOM TO ACCESS THE AIR CONDITIONER. THIS AS OTHERS HAD SAID DID NOT WORK NOR DID ANYONE OF THEIR STAFF KNOW HOW IT WORKED. I WAS TOLD AN HOUR LATER THE AIR HAD BEEN BROKEN FOR MONTHS. THE FRONT DESK CLAIMED THEY NO IDEA IT WAS BROKEN. EVEN THOUGH MANY REVIEWS SAY THE SAME. THE WALL OUTLET( FOR TV FRIDGE, COFFEE MAKER, LAP TOP) HAD ONLY ONE POWER OUTLET WORKING. HAD TO SWITCH BETWEEN USING THE TV AND FRIDGE OR ANY OTHERS. THE BATHROOM TOWEL RACK WAS LITERALLY FALLING OFF THE WALL. THE CURTAINS HAD CIGARETTE BURNS IN THEM. THE FURNITURE WAS SCRATCHED DENTED, WELL USED. THE ONLY REASON I STAYED HERE WAS THE CONVENIENCE TO YOSHIS JAZZ CLUB WITCH IS WALKING DISTANCE. THIS HOTEL WAS PRETTY MUCH A DUMP WHEN IT WAS CALLED THE BEST WESTERN MIAYKO. NOW THE TOMO ALTHOUGH NEWLY PAINTED AND DECORATED IT IS STILL A DUMP WITH CLUELESS EMPLOYEES, FLAT OUT LIES ABOUT ITS CURRENT CONDITION AND A BIT OVER PRICED. IF YOUR LOOKING FOR A CHEAP, CONVIEINANT HOTEL FOR YOSHIS,THE FILMORE OR JAPAN TOWN. DONT EXPECT MUCH. THIS WILL WORK, BUT IF YOUR LOOKING FOR WHAT THEY ADVERTISE. FORGET IT!!!!!
