review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: small, but comfortable. Watchout for those asian-style platform beds. My shins took a beating on those corners! Also, be sure to ask about the A/C. It wasn't working while I was there (12/4/11 to 12/7/11). While it wasn't hot in San Fran, the room does get stuffy/uncomfortable overnight. I had to ask for a fan. Seems like the A/C issue is an ongoing one, as I recall reading earlier reviews with the same complaint. Overall, the hotel served its purpose. Local area is quiet and safe. Very close to the Fillmore.
review.locationRemarks: Went to North Beach (Italian) area for dinner. Best pizza I've ever had at Tony's! You can sit at the bar overlooking the wood-fired pizza oven. Very fun. Golden Gate Park is beautiful. Check out the Japanese Tea Garden; very beautiful and peaceful. If time permits, be sure to take a tour of the wine country. It's really beautiful and you learn a lot about the wineries and their philosophies on wine making.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Temperature controls in the room did not work.

review.title: Funky hotel
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Tomo is a funky little place - perfect for a comfy stay. I really liked the Anime decor. The staff was really nice.

The on-site cafe was decently priced, and the coffee was really good first thing in the morning. I'm not a typical "American breakfast" eater, so the Mums cafe was a reasonably priced choice for breakfast.

The hotel is located across the street from many good Japanese restaurants as well, and conveniently located on the bus route. I'd stay here again!

review.title: Great location for shows at the Fillmore
review.reviewText: Had a great night with the wife, dinner at the shabu-shabu place in the restaurant, walked to the Fillmore for a live show, and walked back to a comfortable, clean, fun room. Worth the money for the a fun night out.

review.title: OK value but wouldn't return
review.reviewText: We liked the location of the hotel - opposite Japantown and a short walk to the shops and cafes of Fillmore St. The room was large and clean but a bit shabby, bathroom definitely not luxury at all and not really the fun manga-styled experience we were expecting (advertised videogames are paid-for). Unfortunately we were in a room right next to the rented-out conference room which meant it was extremely noisy for our first weekend - the hotel offered a room switch. We also heard the lifts and other bathrooms through the thin walls. Staff were all fairly courteous. Free wifi in the room worked fine but was slow. In general the hotel was alright but I'd probably stay elsewhere if I returned to SF.
review.locationRemarks: Fillmore/Nob Hill - close to both the coast and downtown with easy bus access.

review.title: Very Disappointed
review.reviewText: We had booked a 5 day stay at this hotel Thru Expedia for my husband's birthday. We arrived on Friday. We had problems with the air conditioner in the room. You had to use your room key to turn on the AC. The front desk sent a maintenance man to our room to fix the AC. He fixed the AC and the front desk sent a fan to our room. The window in the room understandably only opens about 6 inches because we were on the 3rd floor without a balcony.On Sunday we returned to the hotel in the evening. The AC was broken. I woke up around 2 am hot. On Monday am I called the front desk reporting that our AC didn't work. I was told that the whole hotel AC was broken and they didn't know when it would be fixed. I asked to be transferred to the manager. I was transferred to voicemails each time I tried to talk to someone. I finally called Expedia to resolve the problem. Expedia was extremely helpful. Expedia called the hotel to resolve the problem. The hotel agreed to cancel our remaining reservation. Expedia booked us into another hotel. The hotel manager apologized stating that she was in a meeting earlier when I tried to call. When we checked out, the front desk was checking in customers. They told them the AC was broken. They had put them on the side of the hotel that the air flow would keep their room cool. My disappointement was that Expedia had to resolve the problem. The hotel staff was not helpful.

review.title: Don't believe what they advertise on the website
review.reviewText: I had very bad experience with this hotel which I would rather call a motel. It is old, uncomfortable, staff is not very helpful and it costs way too much for the service they offer. The website is very misleading, be aware of that. I will never stay there again.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText:
Over all satisfied with hotel.

Wifi would not work in room but ok in reception

review.title: Comfortable but not close to City's main tourist places.
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was cordial. The hotel is located across the street from the Japan Center, but it is not convenient if you wish to walk to the center of the City or go to main City tourits places. We spent a lot of money in taxis, going back and forth. The hotel in general is clean and has a restaurant on the premises. The room was clean, except for the carpet and the bed cover. (They need to wash those carpets and replace the bed covers). The room was at the street level and you could hear and see people and cars going by. The housekeeping staff gets in early in the morning, around 7 AM and that is the end of your good night sleep. They engage in loud and personal conversations and constantly slamp doors. The price per room was good but I rather pay more the next time and be more comfortable.

review.title: Funky beds in Japan town
review.reviewText: comfortable rooms, short cab ride from Union Sq

review.title: good value hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel is about a 10 minute bus ride from Downtown San Francisco but the buses are plentiful and cheap. In the centre of Japan town but round the corner are the bars and restaurants of Fillmore Street.
Double queen room and bathroom were average as was breakfast.

review.title: very convenient
review.reviewText:
I checked in to the hotel around midnight without any trouble. It was a huge help after a long day. Room was clean and bed was comfortable.

Had a Japanese style breakfast nest morning at the restaurant in the hotel. Food was good but VERY expensive.

review.title: Carpets should be clean.
review.reviewText: Carpet in the room was very dirty. But overall staff was accomodating.

review.title: ideal place to stay
review.reviewText: enjoyed our stay, quite convenient, safe quiet area. Hotel staff helpful, internet slow however. Would go back

review.title: Noisy and grumpy staff
review.reviewText: A potentially great hotel let down by really grumpy staff - the worst we experienced from any of the 4 hotels we stayed at in San Francisco. Rooms on the website look excitingly designed but are a cheap paint job/reclad over previous aged rooms - manga murals not even directly painted but a print stuck to the wall. Room very noisy with so much sound from the mechanical ducting that we could only sleep with ear plugs Internet slow or not functioning - it should be lightening quick at this Japan town location. Expensive for what it was, don't stay here, there are much better places

review.title: We will be back
review.reviewText: Good neighborhood, wonderful room, very clean and most important not noisy.

review.title: Great location and fun hotel esp. for kids.
review.reviewText: Hotel Tomo is a nice hotel in a great location. It is across the street from Japantown and there are many fun shops and great restaurants. Japantown is clean and I consider, safe. The housekeeping services were wonderful. There were only a few things we didn't like about the hotel. The carpets were a little dirty. They are light colored, so probably get dirty pretty fast. Not filthy, but not clean. Saturday night there was a bachelorette party across the hall from us. It was extremely loud and kept us up for several hours. 2am - 4am. This was upsetting for several reasons. We have young children and we also had an important day planned for Sunday, the Baptism of our infant son. It did affect the day on Sunday, since we were tired. I'm wasn't too happy about that. All in all though, we would consider returning there. Mainly for the location and the fun atmosphere of the hotel .

review.title: great for a night at The Fillmore
review.reviewText: cute, fine, in Japantown

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: A good place to stay.

review.title: Surprise in Japantown
review.reviewText: The Tomo felt more like a boutique hotel than a Best Western!

review.title: Great locationa and cool decor
review.reviewText: Right at the entrance of Japan town. I even found street parking for free over the weekend right in front of the hotel (the hotel parking is full). The restaurant isn't that impressive though. However, the bedding and indoor decoration was very satisfactory. I'd stay here again next time I go.

review.title: Interesting
review.reviewText:
Very cute little hotel - if you like a a simple, more low-key hotel then this would be a good pick. More than half of the staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are always fixed on time. One thing I think could be better is the bed - too bouncy and soft for my taste.

Also, you can request for a shuttle to take you to the airport for $16.

review.title: Great Choice!
review.reviewText: When we were looking for hotels, we needed something that was pretty cheap, and thus we weren't expecting much. Hotel Tomo far exceeded our expectations - the rooms are clean and spacious, the staff are very helpful, and the location is pretty good. The public transport system in San Francisco is very good, so even though it's not very close to any main attractions, it was not difficult to get to them. Japantown is also very nice, and staying right next to Japantown was really cool for us. I will definitely be staying there again if I get to visit SF again!

review.title: No Internet, but everything else was great!
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a moderately-priced hotel near major transit routes (Sutter and Geary Streets), this is the place for you. The physical facilities are clean and attractive (as long as you don't mind its manga-style renovation-see website photos); the staff is friendly and helpful; and there is a variety of ethnic and moderately-priced eateries available across the street in the Japanese Center or a couple of blocks away on Fillmore Street. There are also small Japanese and American grocery stories/delis and a Safeway nearby if you want to pick up food, drinks, or snacks. Although the Internet service did not work during most of our 3-day visit, we were busy enjoying San Francisco and were hardly in the room. This was my second visit to the hotel, and I hope to be there again someday.

review.title: great deal
review.reviewText: Great deal for the price! The hotel is walking distance from a lot of food places and the Japanese market. I was able to call in an order for Ramen and pick it up right across the street.

review.title: Awesome Place to Stay!
review.reviewText:
Really enjoyed staying at Hotel Tomo with my husband and two teenaged daughters. Initially was not sure about staying in Japantown because I was not sure if it would be too far from other sites of interest (Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, etc). Turned out to be a great choice for us. There are many things to do in the immediate vacinity of the hotel. It is across the street from a wonderful shopping district in Japantown. Within a 5 minute walk there is a large Japan-themed mall with much to do, see, buy and eat. This not your regular mall. The hotel staff recommended a number of places, all of which turned out great! It is about a 30 minute walk to Chinatown. The area also seemed very quiet and safe, so I was comfortable letting my teenagers wander around on their own a bit.

The hotel itself was very nice too. It has very fun, funky decor and the rooms are large, comfortable and clean. The hotel staff were all very helpful and accomodating. Even though we checked in a 2am (due a painful flight delay) the desk attendent took the time to give us a map of the environs, and circled places of interest to check out. He recommended a great bakery for breakfast, located just across the street.

I would certainly stay there again if visiting San Francisco. In fact, I'd love to go back there right now!

review.title: Kind of fun, but lacking
review.reviewText:
Neighborhood was fun and different but a LONG ways from other points of interest like Chinatown, Golden Gate Park and the Wharf. It was quiet though and clean and safe.

The bad about the hotel; needs a little TLC, not the cleanest, but clean enough, wifi does not work most of the time, neither did the hotel internet computers.

The room was quirky and had appeal, small, bathroom was old and needed better plumbing.

review.title: Great japan town hotel..close to med center
review.reviewText: Hotel Tomo is a great hotel ..with the friendliest staff..

review.title: very very nice
review.reviewText: can't wait to go back

review.title: good value, will stay again!
review.reviewText:
friendly staff welcomed us to this japanimation themed hotel. great value; convenient location, overall very pleased. parking was about 20 bucks a day, which sounds steep initially, but we were aware of the charge thanks to other traveler's reviews so we booked anyway. we had been to san fran before and know that parking, if actually found, is extremely expensive anyway.

major con: we couldn't figure out the heating so it was very cold, but we had warm and comfy blankets that helped. the beds were a little too firm for me, but my husband, felt they were fine... apparently i like to sleep on clouds! definitely recommend and will stay again!

review.title: I love J Town
review.reviewText: As a native San Franciscan living in Sacramento, I take every opportunity to go back to the City, when I do I love staying close to Japan Town. The Hotel Tomo is the best place to stay in terms of price, and location. Leave the hotel, walk one block and your at Peace Plaza.

review.title: If you like anime and/or manga (Sp?), you'll like ths place.
review.reviewText: Quite a Japanese place. The walls of the room are covered with anime murals; a television in the lobby shows continuous anime, and the in-hotel restaurant is also Japanese, although a Western breakfast is available.

review.title: Cute Hotel!
review.reviewText: Very cute hotel - situated right in Japantown and walkable distance to where you want to go!

review.title: Close to Japantown... easy access for FOOD!!! yummy food!!
review.reviewText: My family and I like the hotel design and location. We love Japanese Food.

review.title: Decent stay at a decent price
review.reviewText: Hotel was comfortable and clean but the desk staff seemingly could not get the keys programmed correctly. Ours kept expiring and requiring that they reprogram. Also, they tried to put us in a room with two queen beds instead of a king like a I paid for but fixed the situation when I brought it to their attention. I'd probably still stay there again.

review.title: Instead of Hotel Tomo it should be called Hotel Don't Go!!!
review.reviewText:
Upon check in we were never greeted. I couldn't believe the person representing this hotel couldn't muster up a hello,how are you? Or even a how did you hear about our hotel? We got nothing!! After receiving our key we enter the elevator to take it up to our room. The elevator breaks and we're stuck in the elevator for approx 10 minutes!!! It was bad enough that the elevator broke with us in it, but we were stuck in there with the crazy maintenance man too! The hotel maintenance man kept punching all the buttons on the key board including the close door button over and over...he had no idea what to do...nice! We finally get out of the elevator and get in to our room. After the elevator incident not one hotel staff member asked if we were ok.
We settle in our room and go to put our drinks in the refrigerator and we find old cheese and pizza left in the fridge. If housekeeping couldn't do something as simple as throwing out the old food from the refrigerator, what else did they miss?? Upon checking out I noticed I was charged $20.00 for parking in the garage overnight. Of course, upon check-in we were never told parking in the garage cost anything. I explained this to the lady and she replied "well there's a big sign stating that we charge $20.00 for overnight parking and no where will you find free parking in San Fransisco". Not an appropriate response to a customer! The only thing good about this hotel is it's location. I will never stay at this hotel again!!!

review.title: Lovely hotel, great service, would stay again
review.reviewText: The hotel was easy to find in a convenient location. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful with directions etc. They also sent a little gift pack up to our room as we were on honeymoon which was really lovely and made us feel very welcome. The decor was really cool and room extremely comfortable. The bathroom was a bit dull and unimaginative, and the hotel was noisy only in that the hotel room doors really slammed loudly which made getting a restful night difficult. Other than these minor points it was a comfortable stay in a good quality and good value hotel.

review.title: Second Of Two
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel with an eclectic style. I suppose it's a little more quiet then Kabuki Hotel, which is across the street. The chairs in the room were a little uncomfortable. I parked in the Japantown garage. It's within good walking distance and you can have a little more peace of mind knowing your car is parked there, instead of on the street. The front desk was friendly. The internet access in the main lobby was convenient, although a little choppy. Typing was halting and uncomfortable, but still worked. I did not enjoy Mum's restaurant on the first floor. Service was slow with barely any customers. The hostess was friendly, but was too busy talking to a friend at the bar. Another customer interrupted her from across the room; because she began using foul language, or because he was having to wait indefinitely for his check. Either way, it wasn't good. It was obvious that she was not interested in being there; she left the restaurant at one point to do something else. If she wasn't intent on being professional, then I'm not inclined to go there again. There are MANY other nearby restaurants that are more cooperative. Ignore Mum's, but stay at the hotel. The guests loved slamming doors and smoking in a non-smoking hotel, but it did not destroy my experience.

review.title: Cheap, comfortable, would definately go back
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and quiet. Very Japanese themed, but overall cute. There was parking for an additional $20 a day, and a restaurant. We didn't eat dinner, just for a drink, but they served hotpot style meals- looked decent. Lots of other great Japanese restaurants around, within walking distance, and hotel was a good walk to Union square and fisherman's wharf, but easily within walking distance. Great value, I would absolutely stay there again.

review.title: we loved it!!! can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: We had an awesome stay! Perfect location... lots of places to go within a 1 distance.. and Bus stops (going to union square) are 2 blocks away... Very cute hotel rooms. We kind of have an issue about the air condition and the light lamp but it was resolved quickly.. and i mean QUICK as in 1, 2, 3! Great people, except for one front desk person--it wasn't that bad but compare to the others who always smile and greet us, he didn't. But we will be definitely come back to this place. Hotel restaurant was a lil small and gets crowded fast.. but no wories, a lot of great and yummy place to eat at with just a few steps out the door. WE LOVED JAPANTOWN!

review.title: Not Impressed at all
review.reviewText: Dirty carpet! Outdated bathroom with dirty shower curtain. Cramped. Someone always smoking at the entrance, very annoying for non-smokers. Always have running water noisy. Elevator doors make funny noise while openning or closing.

review.title: More than does the job.
review.reviewText: It's not The Ritz, but centrally located and comfortable and affordable. If you can get a room on the upper floors as the first floor is literally on the sidewalk, but other than that they answered my every request promptly and correctly.

review.title: hoto tomo was fun
review.reviewText: great view from our room,lot's of things to do in the area within walking distance,front desk was helpful and friendly overall had a great time

review.title: Hotel Tomo 'could be the one for you'
review.reviewText:
Its in Japan Town away from the 'centre'.
However, we grew to like that, especially given the price, the calm neighbourhood and the wonderful public transport.
The receptionists were very helpful, for example, giving us a roll of sellotape to use when I asked for some.
Beds very comfortable. We had 2 double beds in 1 room.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: All as one would expect. Excellent location in Japantown.

review.title: Had a good time!
review.reviewText:
We are a family of 4 ( 2 adults and 2 kids of 10 and 17). The place did the job. Not overly sized but 2 comfortable queen beds and a clean bathroom. The hotel was located in Japantown (didn't know the City had a Japan town!) so not quite downtown but closer to other attractions such as the Presidio, Ashbury -Haight, Alamo square and other attractions that are worth visiting. Public transport (strongly recommended) is the way to go and very easy to use. Bus lines no. 2 and 3 are right in front of the hotel. Located close to Filmore street where you find very nice restaurants, bars, caf, etc. Very convenient after 10-12 hours of walking and site seeing. We tried the restaurant once for breakfast. They are serving the usual eggs-pancakes- toasts-coffee but we prefered to go on Filmore street! The offer is quite large for hotels in SF so shop a lot. I would recommend this hotel as it did a great job for us.

Have a good trip.

review.title: Great spot in a great city
review.reviewText:
Very satisfied with the hotel. We were initially on the top floor, but due to the aged mechanical ventilation system, the room was very noise at night as we were under plant room on the roof. We requested another room and it was all done without a hassle or fuss - so well done to the hotel for handling it all so well.

Also convenient is the internet access in the lobby and the staff were all extremely helpful and courteous. Despite it being a modest hotel (we did like the funky japanese inspired decor), it was just what we were after in a good location (very safe) and easily accessible to all the sights - especially if you enjoy walking. We will be back!

review.title: Excellent choice for Japantown, San Francisco
review.reviewText: All the right things at an affordable price. Great location and great service. An excellent choice for those traveling with elderly travelers.

review.title: would stay again
review.reviewText: GrEat Place!!

review.title: Great location! Unique and fun decor!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the hotel tomo only steps away from japantown!

review.title: Great Getaway!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I went to the Tomo in Spring of 2010, it was wonderful, the people were friendly and helpful, whenever we needed something they would try their best to accommodate us, we had a room on the first floor which we didn't want so they upgraded us to the 3rd floor, it was quiet, clean, modern, the bed is comfy, the view is nice, the paintings are beautiful so is the wood in all the rooms. The hotel is in a nice area, Japatown is clean and quiet. it is a great getaway spot, but it is still in walking or bus distance from all major attractions. Parking is always full so they tell you to park in Japatown center, but we needed our car at 4am to drive to Napa and the garage was closed with our car in it, we had to pay $50 for someone to come and open it plus the nightly rate of $16! So that was annoying. In San Fran you'll want a car to fully see everything it has to offer, also a drive up to Napa Valley is a great choice! All in all it was a wonderful stay and would definitely go back!

review.title: Well located hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is in JapanTown, with its interesting restaurants. Also is located right at good bus line that connects to downtown or to Filmore Street with loads of goood shops and restaurants. The hotel decor is interestly modern reflecting Japanese artistic ideas and the rooms are very comfortable.

review.title: Worth to stay
review.reviewText: I recommend to whom like to asian culture. this area is surrounding with japanese culture such as foods, groceries, entertainment and etc.

review.title: Great Value! Would go back.
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our 4 night stay at Hotel Tomo. The rooms were large and I really liked the bay window which added a lot of natural light to the room. The beds were also very comfortable. My only complaint would be the little fridge that was there. It was much smaller than the mini fridges you get at most hotels. We had a table in our room which was great because we used it for breakfast and for laying out maps on, etc. The hotel is right across the street from a bus line that we used regularly but you could walk to Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf from there (about half an hour walk). There is also a Safeway about 3 blocks away. Lots of restaurants close by. The hotel rate was very reasonable and I would definitely book there again.

review.title: Great location in San Fran
review.reviewText: Hotel Tomo is an interesting little hotel in San Francisco's Japantown. It's pretty standard for a hotel except all over the place are Japanese and anime-themed art and decor. I stayed here for a week with my two friends on our first trip out to California and we found the location to be absolutely brilliant, and the staff was pretty friendly. The only real gripe is that the air conditioning never worked, and we were constantly being told that someone was being sent and finally they just told us to open the balcony door...which isn't really the answer we were looking for but I guess it's a small blemish on an overall positive experience. Parking was $20 a night in a tiny garage but we only had to use it 2 of the 7 nights we were there because street parking was available the other 5 nights. To sum it up - quiet, clean, good value for the money, and in an awesome and interesting neighborhood.

review.title: Great experice and interestng area of San Fran
review.reviewText:
Very nice
Safe and interetesing area ( be sure to go to Lafayette Park for view of BAY)
Thoughtfull, courteous staff
Very clean room
Excellent

review.title: Cute hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel for price, very unique and cute decor with a Japanese theme fitting for being in Japantown. Easy check-in and free wi-fi worked well. I had a minor problem with the front desk booking of an airport shuttle, but the manager was quick to respond and settle the issue easily.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: very nice hotel great location if you want to see the japan cultural area

review.title: Would definitely go back IF.....
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. It was relatively clean. The problem we encountered was that there was no hot water when we tried to shower on New Years day. It sucked! If they could guarantee me that they will have hot showers I'd stay there again.

review.title: NANI
review.reviewText: Tomo was a nice hotel.

review.title: Great stay in Japantown!
review.reviewText: Hotel Tomo was perfectly situated for our stay in San Francisco. We were there as a group of five, to attend the USF December graduation ceremony. With public transportation right outside our door and easy parking attached to the Hotel, getting around was no problem. The hotel was clean, the business center was big help, and the beds were firm but comfortable. We would definitely stay there again!

review.title: San Francisco little Tokoyo!
review.reviewText: Great location, nice restaurants, and easy to walk. Free internet.

review.title: clean but rude
review.reviewText: Hotel room is stylish and clean. nice desk. good wireless internet. good bathroom and bed. locations is ~15 mins bus ride away from all attractions. buses run every 20 mins in front of hotel. Hotel staff is NOT friendly, in fact, i would say they are rude. they gave no help in finding a bus stop, bus number etc. they said go outside to the corner. (there are 4 corners, be specific). shuttle service to airport is $15 each way. they got mad when I asked if they can call the shuttle to come earlier if they are in the area since i finished my business work earlier than my scheduled pick up time. they gave attitude to the shuttle service hence they refused. i called the same number and they happily obliged. OVERALL: it is nice to stay here but dnt expect any sweet service.

review.title: Hard beds
review.reviewText: Very good location. lots of restaurants nearby. The reason I can't recommend...the beds are like sleeping on a board. They were extremely uncomfortable.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
Sadly during the visit the water heater broke leaving us a little chilly. No compensation provided.

Sadly the rooms need to have their carpet replaced as they are on the grungy side.
Great location though.

review.title: Very nice and clean...
review.reviewText: This Japanese style hotel is centrally located next to the Japanese malls. The hotel is very clean, the staff were very nice and the rooms were very modern. There are no unpleasant smells like someone suggested. I frequent San Francisco for business and can honestly say this is a good place to stay for business and with family. It is 22.00 a night to park! No complaints here!

review.title: 'can't wait to go back"
review.reviewText: loved to Tomo. 'the help is especially nice and accomodating.

review.title: Tomo lets Go!
review.reviewText: The iPod charger was broken and the door to the patio wouldn't open. Everything else was great!

review.title: Don't even think about it
review.reviewText: This hotel shouldn't be in business. Smells bad, very much run down. I wouldn't sleep here even when they pay me. Spend $50/day more and get a real hotel.

review.title: Great location for public transport
review.reviewText: The pros: hotel Tomo is ideally situated near bus stops which will take you to downtown union square or North east to the Wharfs. Room was enormous, lovely comfy bed and immaculate. The cons: Tiny bathroom which was very dark but was very clean, shower was tempremental and needed replacing!. Japantown itself was a little quiet for nightlife, but you've got the Fillmore area just a couple of blocks away which has some great bars and restaurants.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and the staff were helpful.

review.title: Great Hotel Tomo!
review.reviewText: Very good hotel, clean and comfortable rooms, wi-fi working everywhere. It's a little bit far from the Fisherman's Wharf but the neighborhood is very interesting and quiet. I would stay here again!!!

review.title: Will visit again!
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic 3 night stay at this hotel. I think the only problem we had was with at least one room key not working on a daily basis - sometimes both didn't work...but the problem was always fixed right away. The location was perfect for a stay outside of the city and away from tourist type areas. Japantown is very tranquil even during the day! There were plenty of places to eat and shop nearby and bus stops right outside the door for easy transportation to the tourist areas! The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Our view of the city was wonderful from the 6th floor and it was a clean and comfortable room with plenty of space. We will stay here again when we visit San Francisco!!

review.title: Comfortable and affordable
review.reviewText: Well located hotel, it matches well with the Japantown atmosphere. It is possible to walk to some of the traditional tourist destinations and certainly has plenty of fun restaurants nearbly. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Unfortunately like most parts of San Francisco the parking was expensive and in short supply but they did have alternatives arranged a short walk away.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: Great location. The shopping at the Japan center was great.

review.title: Nice next to Japantown
review.reviewText: A nice and cheerful basic hotel. Near the bus line, but far from BART. I asked for a room away from the street. It had to be a king bed, which was alright with me. I found the seating uncomfortable. The two chairs were hard like school chairs, and the beanbag was too small. The service was pleasant.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is fun and in good part of town. Stayed with wife and two young kids and it worked our great. Easy to get around from hotel and staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It has a great restaurant on the premises. It is located in Japan town.

review.title: Perfect for soothing night's rest
review.reviewText: Japanese art decor in rooms add to a sense of peace and quiet, especially on a short business where one need's a good night's sleep the very first night in for AM meeting.

review.title: Cleanest hotel we have ever stayed in.
review.reviewText: This hotel is immaculate. It is centrally located to everything with bus stops across the street. We have stayed here before and returned by choice. The staff is efficient and friendly. The housekeeping staff is extremely honest and security minded as we discovered when I left valuables in the safe on a previous trip.

review.title: We so enjoyed our stay and Hotel Tomo and plan to stay there again if we find ourselves in SF.
review.reviewText: Hotel Tomo's staff couldn't be any nicer. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, would highly recommend it to others, and would stay there again if we find ourselves in SF. We ate in the hotel's first floor restaurant and enjoyed our meals. It was centrally located to where we needed to be. I can't say enough good things about this place: affordable, with amenities like a gym, free wireless, immaculate rooms. Bravo Hotel Tomo!

review.title: Clean and functional, if modest and simple
review.reviewText: Modest, simple, but very clean and functional, and the price is decent.

review.title: Best of the 3 Best Western hotels we used in California
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for a week of our 3 week visit to California and found it ideal as a base for exploring San Francisco. Situated in the slightly quieter part of SF in Japantown it provided most of the essentials very well. Spacious rooms, large comfortable beds, clean well designed bath/shower/toilet facilities, room safe, large LCD TV with guest accessible information including billing, wired/wirless internet access for your laptop and the use of 2 free internet PC's and printer in the lobby. Underground parking is available at an additional cost per night. The only disappointment was that, unlike most Best Western hotels, a free complimentary breakfast was not included. However if you are happy to provide your own continental style meal a fridge is provided to keep your milk/juices/yogurts etc fresh. As we ate out each evening with family we didn't sample the hotels own restaurant so can't comment on that. Overall we found this to be an excellent, reasonably priced hotel, extremely clean which provided all of our basic requirements.

review.title: Great proximity to the Fillmore
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, the staff was nice and helpful and best of all it was within walking/stumbling distance from and to the Fillmore. On busline to BART and all SF attractions. Fun, funky place would stay again.

review.title: Fun hotel and great location
review.reviewText: We were very happy with this hotel. It is kid friendly too, we had our 18 month old daughter with us and she loved it. The staff are very friendly, they provided a crib to us as soon as we got there, and were very attentive to our parking and other needs as well. Yes, you have to pay to park here but you'll pay to park anywhere in San Fran, get used to it. I highly recommend this fun hotel.

review.title: Good Value for Money & Good Location
review.reviewText: The Tomo hotel is in a good location, we had no complaints and would happily stay again. The hotel staff were really helpful & friendly. Japantown is nice and safe. Fillmore Street (leading into Pacific Heights) is about 4 stops away on the no. 3 bus and has really nice restraunts, shops & bars. The 2, 3 & 4 busses take you staright into Union Square from outside the hotel.

review.title: Funky and comfortable
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with our 9-month-old baby. The hotel was excellent! Very quiet at night, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and great location. We would go back again.

review.title: Hip Hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: The hotel is ideally situated in Japantown, a quiet oasis from the frenzy of downtown. Everyone was courteous & helpful. Close to numerous interesting shops & excellent restaurants.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Great service. Parking in hotel is not free, but will add $20.00 on your bill. We were there overnight. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel is in Japantown and was definitely quieter than a hotel we stayed in on Lombard Ave. Great place to stay. We would stay again.

review.title: Good place, to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and has been renovated. We liked the Japanese decoration. The bus is just at the door, so it's easy to take it and be ready to go and visit San Francisco. There are restaurants (most of them asian) all around and even in the hotel. It's a good place to stay.

review.title: good choice
review.reviewText: The bed is big and comfortable, and the environment is clean. The light may not be enought for studying, but well enough for relaxing. Overall, I like the hotel. I would like to stay there again when I visit San Francisco next time.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here. The room was very nice. The mural on the wall was very interesting to look at and understand. The location was nice in Japan Town across from the main center. We would definitely go back.

review.title: Fantastic spot
review.reviewText: This was a superb find-thanks to the reviews on Expedia. We could not fault this amazing little place-clean, spacious, comfortable, funky in style. Great hotel cafe in "Mum's"; everyone really helpful and a great location to get around. Extremely safe and a definite place to return to. Thank you Tomo!

review.title: Tomo was Great!
review.reviewText: The room was great! Good size, very clean, very comfortable and uniquely styled. We stayed at a nicer hotel on the Wharf later in the trip and the Tomo was by far the better bargain with better rooms. The location is okay with the rest of the city attractions within a few miles but without the crowds and chaos of other areas. A good stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Fantastic value for money
review.reviewText: Great location and facilities

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable, iPod/iPhone docking alarm clock is a great touch, young crowd in the restaurant, Japanese theme, food good quality

review.title: Japan town San Fransisco
review.reviewText: the hotel was a nice place to stay. Not the best hotel but the staff were very helpful with directions and any requests I had. Walking distance to the Fabulous Fillmore so if you are in town for rock shows its the place to be. the restaurant is ok but nothing to write home about. There are many REstaurants within 2-5 minute walks though so fear not.

review.title: Very nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a quite area, clean bedrooms and bathroom and in front of Japantown, where you can find good Japanese food for only a few bucks. The best people are at the front desk.

review.title: Friendly and Clean
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Tomo for three nights. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Parking was reasonable, though the standard parking rate in SF is pretty steep. It was well located for those who want to touch different parts of the city (GG park, downtown market, Chinatown, etc.) I'd stay there again.

review.title: Very Coool
review.reviewText: This is a very cooool Best Western completely decorated with Japanese Pop Art - giving a feeling of Tokyo Sheek! ...from the decor to the tiny Japanese pop art soaps - - fun, clean and a refreshing place to stay. Great neighborhood to walk around, sight see, eat and shop!

review.title: Good Choice !!
review.reviewText: Once again we had a great time in San Francisco and the Hotel Tomo in Japan Town did not disappoint . It is a fairly quiet area and the room is nice and light with great Pop Art Wall and comfortable beds. The rooms are very clean and there was no reason to complain at all. They also have gaming sessions with Sake Tasting in one of the suites !!

review.title: Pretty Decent place to stay..
review.reviewText: Away from the chaos of the downtown area. Quiet location across from Japantown. Walking distance to Fillmore Street (many small restaurants to choose from) Great location to access any where in the City. Bus stop right out front. Can get anywhere from here quickly.. Complaint: no coffee pot in the room, hot pot with instant coffee and tea. Restaurant on 1st floor open at 7:00 for coffee. The wall murals are a bit different?

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Tomo was like staying at an inn or better quality hostel. The customer service was good. Place very cute and comfortable. Definitely not new looking, but pretty well maintained. Located 10 minutes away by bus from Union Square. Japantown just across the street. Perfect for singles and family/friend getaways. Would not recommend for a romantic getaway.

review.title: Lack of politeness let a fab hotel down
review.reviewText: I have read other reviews saying how great the service was on the front desk, but unfortunately, the service we received was rather abrupt and in one case rude. What a shame, as the hotel (even though its just a themed Best Western hotel) is lovely. The style is constant throughout and gives it a more independent feel. The rooms are MASSIVE, and very comfy with a lovely view from the window seat. There is free wi-fi, though pretty slow and an ipod alarm clock, though ours looked broken as the connector wouldn't have fitted any standard ipod. Its also ideally situated right in the middle of Japan town, which whilst not a massive area, is round the corner from Fillmore, so there is loads of places to eat. There is a bus stop right outside which will take you straight to union square, or from fillmore you can start heading up the city. The bus service is amazing, not like the UK, so you can get anywhere you like pretty quickly. Its also a very chilled out and safe area of San Francisco, so even thought you are on Sutter its not loud at night. So I would never let the service put me off that I received, and would highly recommend the hotel as somewhere different and roomy to stay in SF.

review.title: Surprisingly Comfortable and in a Safe Neighborhood
review.reviewText: This hotel is about 20 blocks from the city center but convenient for me since I was getting surgery at UCSF. UCSF is about 5 blocks away. Japan town is right across the street and there was a gym, restaurant and business office (all small) on site. There is some type of children's center next door so the noise level gets a little loud on the weekday mornings starting around 8 or 9ish. Their parking garage was full so we had and they charge $20 per day to park there. They sent us to another garage that was $15/day so keep this in mind.

review.title: Better Than Expected
review.reviewText: Even thought I had spent hours perusing hotel reviews online, I was still a bit apprehensive about booking a room at Hotel Tomo. I should not have been, because it surpassed my expectations. The hotel had recently been renovated and everything was clean and fresh. My kids LOVED the decor (even though we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel). The staff was super-friendly and helpful, and we were well taken care of during our stay. As advertised, we did have free internet. My only complaint was the lack of TV channels (4 analog stations, of which only one came in without static), but we weren't there to watch TV. The Japantown area is very clean, friendly, and safe, and the hotel was an easy 6 block walk from the California line cable car, which we used for our main mode of transportation (purchase the all-day $11.00 pass, which can be used on cable cars, street cars, or buses). We also booked a city bus tour online and the bus came to the hotel door to pick us up. I would definitely recommend this hotel for price, location, and service.

review.title: Ideal for failies with younger kids!
review.reviewText: As a regular visitor to Japan I didn't find the hotel or the area really 'Japanese' and the one meal we did have in one of the 'Japanese' restaurants in the Japan Centre was disappointing! Location is OK, with very good public transport into the main center of SF. The staff at the Tomo are very helpful and although the parking is limited managed to fit our oversized SUV into a suitable space! I would recommend this hotel for families with younger or early teenage kids. It's fun and funky!

review.title: Nice Clean Hotel, Excellent and Helpful Staff, Bus Stop Right Across Street, Nice Safe Area
review.reviewText: Thr room was large and very clean. The staff was extremely helpful. They gave us directions to get to attractions and any other place we needed to go. The hotel is in a quiet area. We were very comfortable in the community. The bus stop is right across the street. They helped us make tour arrangements and we were picked up at our hotel. We had a wonderful time and will definitely stay at the Tomo again.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The room has IKEA like furniture, simple, modern and serve the purpose. The bean bag chair is not as comfortable as it looks. It is located right in the Japantown, so it is very convenient if you like to Japanese food at reasonable price. Japan Center has other stores too. When we came back late one night, the hotel parking was full so I had to park at the Japan Center. With the receipt, the hotel waive the over night parking fee. It is a very short walk and I find it safe walking at night. Overall, we like the location and will stay again.

review.title: Great stay at Best Western Hotel Tomo
review.reviewText: Room was clean, beds were confortable and staff were very friendly and helpfull. Would stay there again.

review.title: anime, manga not my thing, but still a good place to stay
review.reviewText: I guess the anime/manga decor is meant to appeal to a younger clientele, or families with kids into that kind of culture. but we stay there because we like the location in S.F. "nihonmachi" (Japantown) for an affordable price. Its clean, comfortable, and the only drawback is that the parking lot cannot accommodate very many cars. and you have to pay extra for parking.

review.title: I recommend it!
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Tomo. The room was much larger than the room I saw at the nearby Hotel Kabuki (relatives were staying there). The staff and people at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Tomo again!

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Hotel was trendy and comfortable. It was a very convenient location near great restaurants and bus stops. Would definitely recommend hotel and Japantown in general for San Francisco stays.

review.title: So fun...so cute
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a really neat part of San Francisco, Japantown, and very close to other well known areas. The great view from our window was overlooking the city. It is within walking distance to public transportation, a variety of restaurants, a grocery store, and amazing shops. I would definitely stay here again if given the opportunity.

review.title: Cleanliness?
review.reviewText: I am not really sure if the towels were clean, but aside from that it was AWESOME!

review.title: Better than expected.
review.reviewText: Delightful hotel- I was made to feel welcome and cared for. Calm, relaxed atmosphere, spotlessly clean - every member of staff was friendly and very helpful with my various queries. I liked the relaxed informal atmosphere in the restaurant on my last evening. Excellent location, felt safe walking to the bus stop, and to the grocery store a couple of blocks down the road. I would definitely stay at Hotel Tomo again. Thanks everyone!

review.title: Just felt very comfortable! CANT WAIT TO GO BACK
review.reviewText: IT IS A VERY COMFORTABLE HOTEL TO STAY IN SAN FRANCISCO, THE WORKERS ARE VERY POLITE. THE LOCATION IS REALLY NEAR THE BEST ATTRACTIONS FROM THE CITY, BUT THE BEST IS THAT WE COULD JUST GO WALKING TO FILMORE STREET, WHICH IS A VERY GOURGOUS AREA FULL OF FINE BOUTIQUES!

review.title: Sit at the bar in the restaurant. lots of locals, very friendly vibe.
review.reviewText: Totally cute and charming...and funky.

review.title: Great trendy hotel at a reasonable price
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel bc my father was having surgery at UCSF. Hotel is in a great location - quiet, cute neighborhood (Japantown) with plenty of places to eat nearby. The hotel staff was very pleasant and accommodating. We needed an early check-in and a late check out, both which were honored without hassle. I was really surprised how much I enjoyed this hotel. It's perfect for the tech-dependent too (such as my husband and I are) with free wi-fi, a pretty big flat screen and an ipod dock alarm clock. These are perks that make a huge difference since many of the large hotels don't offer wi-fi and service is often patchy as well, even when you pay. The decor is fun and playful. This hotel would be a basic Best Western, but because it is decorated in such a trendy way it really gives the hotel lots of personality. I also liked that the toiletries were of nice, higher-end quality from a company called Lather from Pasadena whose products I've used in the past and have been pleased with. My husband and I will definitely stay here the next time we plan a trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Pretty room
review.reviewText: This hotel was very unique and pretty design on the ceiling and wall. It showed Japanese style very well and the breakfast in the restaurant was as good as the room. I really enjoyed staying there and I would like to stay again if I have another trip to San Francisco. However the picture hanging in the room was rather freakey (japanese lady's eye - very freaky)

review.title: Would go back to
review.reviewText: Funky hotel near Japantown and fillmore area. Reasonably priced,and good service.

review.title: Fun and entertaining hotel
review.reviewText: Staying in Japantown in SF is a new experience for me, and my travelmate and I were both pleased with Hotel Tomo as our choice. We had a really great room with two queen beds, a refrigerator that made ocean sounds, and the Do Not Disturb signs were adorable. We were able to check in when we arrived around 9am, which was lovely after a long morning of travel, and the hotel is located within a few blocks of a grocery store and some really amazing eats. Also close to many bus lines. I will be returning to Hotel Tomo again next time we go to San Francisco!

review.title: decent stay
review.reviewText: we booked flight+hotel for 4 nights through expedia and got an awesome deal. it's located exactly as i want to be, right in the heart of japantown. the hotel has a shabu shabu restaurant on the first floor, but we didn't try it. there's a convenient store right next to the hotel (where we buy water) and japantown is just across the street. housekeeping does an awesome job at keeping our room clean. we see the housekeeping lady every morning, very friendly and all smiling face. overall, i would stay at hotel tomo again.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Not enough parking.

review.title: If only all Best Westerns were like this, I would stay forever
review.reviewText: They advertise this as a fun hotel and it definately is. The service was fantastic. We booked 2 rooms via the internet in error. Without asking, the front desk mgr right away called to ensure the second booking was credited to our credit card. After we thanked her she said it would have been a hassle for us and it was easy for her to do! The rooms are super clean. The decor fun and really cool and very spacious. There's even a t-shirt vending machine in the lobby typical of Japan. Location is great-across from Japantown. We felt very safe. The only bad thing was they renovating the business centre in the hotel so computer access was off limits.

review.title: finally found the best hotel in SFC
review.reviewText: a very clean and neat hotel. we loved the interior of the room and bathroom amenity items. great location if you like Japanese food and shopping around Filmore Street. Also easy access to the downtown SFC and other major places with the public transportation. we definately are going back to this hotel when we travel to SFC.

review.title: Moderately priced, fun decor, and central SF location.
review.reviewText: Newly remodeled with everything fresh and new, so not showing the normal wear and tear of even the most well-maintained hotels. Convenient parking in the first floor garage was moderately priced and allowed unlimited in-and-out privileges. In a quiet and interesting part of SF, within walking distance of Pacific Heights and Hayes Valley shopping areas. It's not really near any major tourist destinations and yet it was easy to get to everything we needed to see. Japan Center across the street offers many choices for food. My only complaint was the noise (fan rattle/compressor?) from a ceiling vent near the bathroom, but being an urban dweller, I could ignore this white noise. The small bathroom seemed somewhat neglected from a design perspective given the fun art and furnishings in the main room, but the toiletries smelled great. I had always stayed near Union Square on previous trips, but enjoyed this off-the-track location.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: Rooms are clean and fresh (recently remodeled). Beds are firm and very comfortable. Hotel parking are fill up fast on a weekend night. Offsight overflow parking is available.

review.title: Quiet, comfortable, conveinent
review.reviewText: Asked for and received room in quiet location. Front desk gave good restaurant and transportation tips, printed my boarding pass, let my friend park in their garage for a few hours for free. Loved the empty mini fridge which I filled with groceries from the store 2 blocks away. Right next to the bus stop, a 24 hour Denny's and an excellent Thai restaurant 100 feet away on Buchanan Street.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: A nice hotel for the price. Only thing, I kept hitting my legs with a corner of the bed frame which was too sharp.

review.title: I liked it
review.reviewText: The location is great. Just out of the way of the crowds but close enough to walk or short bus ride to Chinatown, North Beach, Embarcadero, Union Square.. 3 block walk to another bus line to Golden Gate Park and Haight-Ashbury. Service was very good and friendly. Room was small, but that's to be expected in this city. It had a modern/japanese theme to it, kind of unique. The thermostat didn't work and it did get chilly at night. Also, the hot water to the shower was not very hot. They offered me a different room, but I declined, wasn't that important to me. Wireless Internet signal was very weak, unusable. The wired connection had an unusual port, had to buy a special cable for it to work. If perfect-comfort is not a priority, I'd recommend it. Tomo is in a fantastic location, concierge was excellent, and for the price, I had a terrific time in the city staying here.

review.title: Would love to go back
review.reviewText: We found our rooms extremely clean, spacious and restful. Japantown itself is a great part of town in which to stay: interesting, safe and filled with wonderful shoips and restaurants. It's within walking distance of Fillmore St., another great place for dining and shopping.

review.title: I thought there was a mistake with our booking!
review.reviewText: Having been to SF several times before, I know Japantown well, the hotel is very easy to get to on regular bus services from the centre of the city. The entrance is very bright and modern with a Japanese feel and the desk service was also extremely helpfull. Our room and bathroom was first class too,the small bay window offering a view over Buchanan street and some of Japantown, the beds were very comfortable and we loved the art which covered the whole of one wall I began to think we were being undercharged and that we might have had a mistake with our booking as the price was very competitive. There was a good sized flat-screen tv, a radio with IPOD port and net access for laptops. I found the free electronic safe very handy too for money, passports etc The best touch was left to the end though when I asked if we could leave our luggage at the hotel 'till it was time to go to the airport.... the rooms must be vacated by 12 noon, but the hotel will keep your baggage 'till you need to go which means you can clear your room, head downtown for lunch/shopping and return when YOU want to,they really couldn't have been more helpful oh there was also a fridge in the room to keep that fruit juice (and Anchor steam beer) cool! First class, the school parties, private travellers and businessmen who frequented the hotel seemed to agree.

review.title: great place and people
review.reviewText: we had a great time here and the hotel was renovated from two years ago - our last stay. good location and nice people at the hotel

review.title: Great deal , great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel with very well designed room,comfortable bed and clean.Great location in quite Japantown with quality restaurants just 2 min away, specially if you like sushis.Helpful staff. Very good deal for SF.

review.title: Awesome place to stay
review.reviewText: The location is not extremely convenient to Union Square, where tourists like to go, but is adjacent to Pacific Heights which is a great neighborhood to shop in and dine at. It's also in Japantown, with some great authentic Japanese restaurants. The hotel is essentially a motel but with amazing modern Japanese decor and a cool lobby. The rates were great, especially for the neighborhood. My only complaint is that housekeeping did not make up our room on either day we were there. The first day we were in and out of the room all day and they kept coming when we were in and then when we were finally out of the room for hours at a time, it was after 8:30. The second day they didn't come at all but by the time we figured it out, there was no point in asking them to come. I think they must have limited housekeeping hours. Also, their small parking garage was often filled by the end of the day when we returned to the hotel so we had to park on the street. It would have been nice if they had access to an offsite garage- they may have but they didn't tell us about it. No in-room coffee machine and no room service (but they have a menu in the rooms for a place that delivers).

review.title: Clean, comfortable, and quiet
review.reviewText: We were impressed with how clean this hotel was. The staff was helpful and curtious. As first the room seemed small, but once we got into it, it was fine. We had a room with a small fridge, that was nice. The beds were very comfortable and Sutter Street is pretty quiet at night. Didn't have any problem with that. We liked being in Japantown, but to get on any buses we had to walk 2-3 blocks in any directions. Parking was very resonably priced. We thought the decor was fun - Japanese Pop Art. Would go back here - didn't seem like the boring old Best Westerns I have been in before.

review.title: Delightfully different...
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at Hotel Tomo. From the first sight of the video screens and couch that looked like it was from under the sea in the lobby, the graphics on the ceilings, the mural and artwork in our room, the colors, to the hip wood furniture and Fatboy beanbag, we were smiling! The room size and layout is like any midpriced hotel we've ever stayed in, but the touches add a lot of fun and make it special. The lower floor rooms have a square bay window with a curtain that creates a delightful private space. We enjoyed breakfast at Mim's in the hotel, and had a late-night dessert there. We parked at the Japan Center garage two blocks away, and it turns out to be less expensive than parking at the hotel. It was affordable and out of the ordinary. We will definitely stay there the next time we are in San Francisco!

review.title: Eclectic and affordable
review.reviewText: We were a little wary of staying at the Tomo, as the website showed only a few pictures, and the theme seemed to be bright coloured plastic. Well, it was definitely trimmed out with bright colours and plastics, but it was a great value. Unless you have a tremendous aversion to contemporary design, this place is a score. It was apparent that there had been a recent renovation, as everything was in great condition. The staff were very nice, although we had little need for them, but they were helpful whenever we did need something.

review.title: Best Western Tomo!
review.reviewText: This hotel was very cute and I really enjoyed the room designs. The room was clean and comfortable. The parking garage is very small and gets full quickly, but luckily we got there in time to get a spot.

review.title: For a 3 star hotel the Tomo gives you a clean, comfortable room with features of a 3.5 star hotel.
review.reviewText: For a 3 star hotel the Best Western Tomo gives you a clean, comfortable room with such features as flat screen TV, and WI-FI access through-out the hotel. Also - a great location in Japantown which is a central location in San Francisco.

review.title: The bed is extremely comfortable
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and organized. The giant beanbag and white LCD TV was cool although there were like 7 channels lol. The hotel is across from 2 Japanese shopping centers that have uncountable number of japanese restaurants and shabu shabu. Cons: the parking SUCKED b'c the lot has like 20 spaces and SUPER hard to get into...worse than chinatown parking lots in LA. Super Pro: The bed is incredibly comfortable...I want one at home! Overall, very nice and comforatble hotel to stay at. I recommend it...I did a lot of comparisons with the hotels in the area in price and accomodations-wise. I'm very picky when it comes to hospitality, so trust me haha.

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: A truly fortunate hotel finding. Great location in Japan Town. Lots of oriental restaurants, a Dennys all cheap shopping all within a few minutes walk. Do not need a rental car as the Geary Ave bus line to downtown, Union Square and Embecardero one block from hotel. Room was quiet and recently remodeled. Staff was knowledgeable and helpful with directions to near and far attractions. Definitely will stay here again.

review.title: Great themed hotel
review.reviewText: The Miyako Inn was a really cute place to stay. Located near most of the hustle and bustle of Japantown, it was close by to all the places I needed to get to for this trip. I had a corner room with a queen bed. Hotel room was okay as far as everything was concerned. The TV was flat screen, but we had trouble figuring out the remote for the TV because the sensor was hidden behind the television. The fridge in the room was not plugged in and had a bug in it. Although I did not get any, my traveling companion got some bug bites from staying in the room. The bathroom lighting was a little dim also. Showing was a little hard because of that. And all the soda machines were sold out on the three floors I tried to get drinks from. Despite all of that, the bed was extremely comfortable and I really liked the theme of the room. The iPod dock was a handy addition to the room. And that bean bag thing in the room (I think it's called a fatboy) was very comfortable to sit on. This was an okay place to stay. I have to admit I've stayed at better hotels in the area for the same price.

review.title: Reasonably priced hotel in a nice part of town
review.reviewText: The Best Western Miyako is located in San Francisco's Japantown, a nice, quiet part of the city conveniently located for the economy traveler or tourist. It is equidistant, a couple miles, to Fisherman's Wharf and Haight-Ashbury. The lobby and the accommodations in general are modest. There is a school adjacent to the hotel, but the noise during recess time wasn't bothersome. The Best Western Miyako is a good place for an economy traveler, who only wants a comfortable to place to relax and sleep. But if you're used to going first-class and insist on the finest accommodations money can buy, it's probably not the place for you.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: This is the 3rd time I've stayed at this hotel.  The main reason I use this hotel is for its location.  It's close to all the major attractions and since I love Japanese food its an obvious choice being just across the street from Japan Town.  I'd like to point out that not all rooms have high speed internet available.  I had to change rooms because of this.  And as someone else has said there is a rumbling of ventilation fans.  They have a parking garage available for $15 per day.  That seems to be the going rate for the area.  Oh, one more thing, the eggs benedict in their restaurant was great!

review.title: Nice hotel, pleasant staff, great location, good restaurant
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, Japantown is a wonderful corner of SF that is worth exploring with nie boutiques walking distance on Fillmore, also near movie theaters. Staff is gracious, polite and helpful. Restaurant quite good and reasonable, good restaurants walking distance. Rooms are a reasonable size and reasonably comfortable.  Only complaint, wish there internet service was more reliable.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Very convenient, easy access to downtown or Fisherman's Wharf.Great access to Japan Town.

review.title: Wet carpet, noisy, and totally stunk!
review.reviewText:
At this particular branch of the hotel the architect seems to have gone to great lengths to make sure all guests suffer from hearing loss and sleep deprivation.
The ventilation system comes with complimentary non-stop aircraft-hanger quality wind turbines designed to make sure that you are fully prepared for the next day's jet travel. Standard ear plugs are insufficient to reject its noise. Further detail is in the unique self-washing feature the carpet is endowed with, which allows bathroom water to freely seep over the carpet, even when you have neglected to use the shower or bathroom in any way. Just wear Wellington boots inside (no socks) and you'll be fine.
